title: Scared to take propranolol
content: I was prescribed 10mg but reading the side effects made me anxious because it says 1 in 1000 people may have a heart block or heart failure caused by the medication and now im scared to take it.

title: Doctors said heart is fine despite elevated heart rate
content: Long story short, my doctors have checked my heart. They have heard it and said there were no disruptions or murmurs. They did a heart failure blood test Which came back normal. They did an ECG which came back normal. They've done all the checks and said that my heart is healthy and strong and they didn't identify any other issues related to deficiencies or anemias yet despite this since October last year when I randomly got unwell I've been getting persistent tachycardia heart rate sits in the high 90s when sitting despite my Fitbit telling me my resting heart rate is 67 beats per minute. I've been out of work from about half a year and going to the gym about three times a week doing weights but never cardio. But since October my heart rate just shoots up now even just going up the stairs it goes up to 130bpm and then it will stay in the 100 standing up and then when I Lift weights or run on the treadmill. Just light intensity. Exercise will take it to 160 or 170. Yet despite all of this, the doctor say my heart is healthy and strong and nothing is wrong. I'm on beta blockers now Propranolol 10 mg which do help lower it at rest but during exercise it's still the same symptoms, As a result, I've lost a considerable amount of muscle mass. All the time I just feel on edge about this. It's unusual. It's never been like this before Is this really just anxiety?

title: Mirtazapine 15mg
content: Hi does anyone take mirtazapine 15mg and how does it make you feel? I struggle with anxiety and health anxiety so terrified of side affects im 13weeks post partum and my anxiety has returned baddd. I am currently on amitriptylije 15mg to gelp with insomnia induced anxiety but feel i meed something to help my anxiety at the same time. I am scared it will completely knock me out and i wont wake up with ny little girl in the night im also scared of emotional numbing or stertonin syndrome im just terrified of new tablets but i think i really need something for my anxiety now

title: Exhausted from anxiety
content:
Hey everyone! I don't even know how to start since it's my first reddit post or post in social media in general, but I've been struggling with health anxiety/panic attacks for 2 months now, I do want to know if there are people who had somewhat similar experience and could tell me how are you coping with everything 🙏 since I'm still one week away from my first visit to psychologist and I don't really know who to talk to who would understand how I feel. 

Basically it all started 2 months ago after a party, next morning I started to feel anxiety which escalated to a panic attack and lasted for a whole hour then went to ER they didn't find anything wrong, gave diazepam and released me, day after one more PA, then psychiatrist diagnosed me with PA wrote a prescription for bromazepam and released me. After first 2 attacks I started experiencing anxiety and constant fear of something bad happening to me... I went to cardiologist who checked my heart and told me that everything is OK, but somehow it didn't helped me to feel better. I did party one more time at the new year, and it was a mistake because for a whole week I felt bad anxiety and experienced panic attacks to the point where I couldn't control them anymore and took bromazepam. No more drinking and vaping ever again.

I did quit nicotine, alcohol, caffeine, fixed my sleeping schedule started to use ashwagandha so now I experience severe anxiety and PA less often(yesterday I had one attack after 3weeks without them), but I still feel anxiety sometimes a few times in a day. It sucks big time that I even want to start vaping again due to stress but I know that I can't :(

title: Anybody have severe anxiety all day but then it fades before bed?
content:
My cycle is always the same - wake up a little too early, then as I become more conscious the anxiety comes rushing in and is there pretty much all day. But about an hour or two before bed it lets up.

I'm trying to figure out if this means anything? Or if there's some state in my body that I can replicate throughout the rest of the day. It's like not quite sleepy yet, but pre-sleepy?

For context I'm going through a separation right now, and the biggest things I'm worrying about are that and my mental health.

title: This has been annoying me for a while now!!

I don’t even panic about it or an anxious about the fact that I’m hyperventilating but instead I’m annoyed. I’ve been letting my anxiety be without me interrupting it thats why im less anxious consciously but thr hyperventilating is too annoying and makes me feel disconnected and/or dizzy sometimes

I just turned this on so I'm not sure how useful it is yet, but PLEASE steer clear of politics if they make you anxious, they turn a bad day into a horrible one

title: If you had a kid
content:
Would you fight your depression if your girlfriend was pregnant? My boyfriend is verry depressed , he doesnt want any kind of help . I love him he is my soulmate , and he knows im there for him every day every second . 
Im just wondering what he would do if im pregnant . He always said he wanted a family life . But everyday i hear how mutch he wants to die . Im not gonna babytrap him , i feel like it would give him motivation. And if i have to puke everyday to do that for him and have a mini us laying around . I wouldnt think twice , if i bring it up now he says no . Because i dont have work and i dont have a home for myself (he does) hes 30 im 21 . I never wanted a kid before him , he made me realize that you can love someone so deeply that you want to create a human being . 
Im really trying to understand him , i was depressed myself for 3 yeara and was hospilized so many times . My depression just went away . Was it because of prayers? I dont know but they were anwsered . 
He also is ashamed when he is "weak" i dont think hes weak when showing his emotions . But he doesnt want me to lay with him or anything . I think hes scared that i see him as a weak man who cant provide for me . 

Also . He has alot of anger issues , he can be mad at me for something so little that i dont even know anymore . When i was depressed i was really mad at the world and i outed it on my mom . I yelled ar her , cussed her out . Said everything was her fault . So im not mad at him for being mad . But i am scared of my future , i dont wanna be that couple that fights everyday . And even tho he promised me he would never touch me . I cant look in the futere

Oh and hes most of the time depressed when im not there . When im there yea he can have depressed thoughts but its never that bad when im not there . He hurts himself , chugs 4 bottles in a few minutes , takes pills . He doesnt do that when IM with him because he knows i will leave . I cant stand to leave him . Were connected by soul , he can feel IN HIS SLEEP when im about to have a panic attack . I can feel when something is wrong with him . 

I dont think i can ever let him go . 
But i cant live with this for my whole life

title: Going to start exercising (again) need help
content: Hey guys to sum everything up Im 20 years old and struggle with health anxiety, the health anxiety I struggle with is fear of having heart problems or having a heart attack because of chest pains, shortness of breath, arm pains and jaw pains. Although I already got checked and they say my heart is healthy I still continue to struggle. Anyways before all this started I was a gym rat, started my journey because I was fat and wanted to become more fit to honestly impress a girl but ended up falling in love with health and fitness. Anyways then came the health anxiety and stopped completely, lost all my progress and got even fatter from 1 year and gain 30 pounds and lost my muscle. Anyways I’ve been trying to get back in it but now exercise does not feel the same I get short of breath but like 5x more and I’m constantly on edge. Every time I would leave the gym I would feel worse then how I felt when I went in. Honestly that discouraged me so much I stopped going again and well here I am trying to go back and going to try to stop caring how I feel or what I feel because I’m causing more harm getting fatter then going to the gym. Anyways I need tips and if you guys have had a similar experience. Thank you all for reading I know it’s a long one.

title: Starting my first full time job next week, the anticipation is killing me
content:
Hi all,

Like the title says I am starting my first full-time, 9-5, mon-Fri, job as a liaison on Monday. I suffer from generalized anxiety that primarily focuses on health and have OCD. I am 24M that has other health issues like type 1 diabetes and hypertension, yet these conditions are well controlled.

I am having really bad anticipatory anxiety waiting for my start date. I keep thinking about changing my routine and schedule. I do not do well with change at first and takes me some time, but I know that it is best for me. I am also worried how I'll have to adapt my health conditions to the new schedule.

I am overly worried about being anxious on the job and it pushing my blood pressure up to the point where I'll have a medical emergency. I have these thoughts despite knowing my levels are controlled and I've been on meds for literally 20 years.

Idk, sort of a venting post but also wanted to ask for any thoughts or advice. Thank you for reading!

title: Sudden onset GAD that turned into panic attacks
content:
I started having GAD after the su*c*de of my best friend. It lasted for about 2 months and I kept smoking weed then one night the worst panic attack I’ve felt so far. Since then the GAD has diminished and is probably 80% better. But now slightly stressful events cause my to get panic attacks which feel like a surge of adrenaline. This is followed by days of derealization. Can anyone relate? 

I feel like my GAD was mostly physical symptoms that where 24/7 most of those symptoms are gone and I honestly thought I may have overcame anxiety but then one day I’m getting my hair cut and boom panic attack. It was super embarrassing but what can you do. They aren’t nearly as strong as the first one and I’ve quit pot it’s been nearly 4 months. (6 months since losing my friend and the beginning of my symptoms) I just think it’s weird how I no longer spend the majority of the day worried about physical symptoms of GAD and I just get hit with random waves of panic. Seems like once a week or so. I’ve began to avoid triggers but I don’t think that’s the smart thing to do. I was just hoping that somehow naturally i would just stop having these issues since I’ve always been extremely confident and relatively fearless. I went from having a 6 figure construction business in my early 20s to being afraid of getting  hair cut. Thanks if you have any insight or personal stories that may help me figure this out.

title: Does it just all boil down to sitting in your own discomfort
content:
I have struggled heavily with depression and anxiety for about 4-5 years of my life now. I have tried therapy, been on and off medication, and tried every single technique in the book but ultimately I feel like it all just boils down to my brain neurotransmitters being messed up and nothing can be done. In therapy, I have tried so many techniques, even addressed my childhood trauma, and have had periods of my life where things seem to be going right for me, or when things seem to be going horribly, and I would say I have relatively been the same level of anxiousness (everything just feels like putting a bandage on a gashing wound). Therapy has helped a lot but I feel like underlying through every tip, technique, and discussion is just sitting through your own discomfort and being okay with being uncomfortable/embracing what comes your way. Is life just a constant battle of just sitting through anxiety? But what if every single second of the day is a battle and it's beyond exhausting and you just don't know much more you can sit through it, how much more you can hate yourself? 

Side note, for people where anxiety/depression doesn't debilitate every single aspect of your life, how great must that be? My brain works like overtime trying to get through my day and also manage the 24/7 influx of thoughts I have, along with physical symptoms.

title: air hunger?
content:
hey everyone,
i joust found this reddit page and i've been hoping to talk to someone who experiences the same. i've been having constant air hunger now for like half a year. ive been having a really rough time since may last year when i first found that my mental really started affecting my physical health. i've been experiencing so much stress and anxiety which then gave me soo many symptoms like chest and back pain, headaches, problems with my digestion and all that stuff. it's been really hard on me. but the toughest symptom to deal with is 100% air hunger. 

now i don't have a therapist yet (im currently looking into getting therapy) but from everything i've read so far it's not anemia but definitely air hunger. and when it first started i literally thought i was dying and almost had to call paramedics. i eventually learned to handle it better but it literally ruins my life like i can't even explain how terrible it makes me feel. i have time where it's worse for like a week or two and then it gets better for a month and then it gets worse again. i constant have to take deep breaths and i cant and when i cant it causes me so much anxiety and stress. i constantly have to yawn but i cant? and when i finally manage to yawn it feels SOO good. 

this stuff really has a huge impact on me. for example; i get so incredibly hysterical when even the smallest thing stresses me out like when my boyfriend sometimes just talks too much when i have a really bad phase its soo bad and i have to tell him to shut up and not talk to me for a few minutes so i can regulate my breathing. im currently in a phase where it's really bad again ever since my mom and i fought 2 days ago over how she wanted to surprise me with decorating my room and organizing things in a new drawer and that stressed me out SO MUCH. like im telling you i've been yelling at her not to do that and asking why she would just put my stuff in other places. i felt so bad after because she just wanted to surprise me but that really caused my air hunger to get worse again and now im just in constant stress. 

i really can't handle it anymore :( i feel like my life is falling apart because of it and i've tried numerous breathing exercises and all that stuff and nothing seems to help. does anyone else experience this? am i just mentally fucked up? i don't know what to do :/

title: Anxiety in College
content:
I don’t want to go into a lot of detail for animosity purposes; but I’m in need for advice. 

My background: Male, 20s, international student in the U.S. at a small college (~3500 undergrads). I love my academic department, and the classes I’ve experienced beyond it (except for one) went terrible for me. First semester, great. I finish with a 3.67. Two semesters later, I’m standing at a 2.48. 

I’m majoring in Physics. It’s a hard subject for sure - it takes me many hours to get my work done. But I would even perform in a more mediocre way in the “ easy” courses, like Philosophy, Education, Psychology, etc. 

My experience as an international in the U.S. has definitely been traumatic at most. Now, I’m hooked on marijuana and Xanax, otherwise I cannot sleep not feel calm to leave my dorm. I’ve developed addiction issues and severe social anxiety. 

For those who’ve ever experienced/witnessed paranoid anxiety, what are some tips and tricks to deal with the draining energy of stress? How have you started loving yourselves? 

I’m willing to answer questions I find appropriate and deeming as beneficial. Thank you.

title: NOCTURNAL PANIC ATTACK?!
content: hi all i’m 29F and i think i just had my first experience with nocturnal panic attack. I randomly woke up around 1:30 am and felt very strange. I tried to brush it off but then I just couldn’t. My heart rate was high around 100 which could be considered normal (idk) and i stood up and immediately felt slightly blurry and i had tingling in my neck. I called my aunt who’s an NP just to reassure myself i wasn’t dying or needed to call 911.. I talked to her for 10 mins and basically cried over a current fear. i think talking and letting that out helped me feel better. Does anyone else have experience with this? I do suffer from anxiety a lot in crowds and other situations but never had this happen before.

title: The dizziness and floaty feeling is killing me, is there anything that can help? Has anyone found a solution?
content: I have had on and off dizziness for a few years and im mostly sure its anxiety. Lately its been getting worse. When im laying i feel like my legs are floating up constantly and when sitting they feel like theyre sinking. When i walk i wobble around and feel like im floating or sinking. For the last few weeks i havent done anything else except lay down. Nothing else. I cant. I tried crafting today and everything i looked at felt huge... I tried just continuing but i got so dissociated i didnt understand what i was looking at. Then i got scared about it and went to lay down again. I have tried going for a walk but managed to walk 10 mins before i felt like i was swaying everywhere and i literally couldnt walk straight. My mom was confused what i was doing. I said im dizzy af and she said to just ignore it. But i cant. Sometimes i froget about it for some time and it goes away. Then i remember and it keeps building up again. I cant get peace from it. Its the only thing i think about and im aware im so tense all the time its propably making it worse or straight up the cause. How do i just forget it? When i go outside i go in my little bubble where all i feel and think about is the dizziness and i dont notice anything around me. I forget to check for cars or people coming towards me and im always in awkward or even dangerous situations. If my mom speaks i dont hear her. I try so so hard to just focus on my surroundings but then i get scared and panicy when i notice the dizziness again. Every night when i try to sleep and close my eyes it starts building up and getting worse and worse but lessen to almost nothing when i open my eyes. Then i close and same thing again. Im in this situation rn its 4 am i cannot sleep or think straight im so exhausted. This is hell. What the actual heck can i do??

title: Anyone’s anxiety spiral out of control so quickly?
content: It starts with small things but before I know it my legs feel like they’ve stopped working, my heart pounds in my chest and I feel like I’m going to pass out from a panic/anxiety attack. I spiral so quickly I feel like I can’t prevent the attacks at all. It’s horrible at work especially when I have to try and hide this stuff. Anyone relate? Advice would be appreciated

title: Proper diagnosis?
content: I’m going to start off by saying I don’t really know much about mental health so excuse if I sound dumb😅 I grew up in a family that made it seem like you’re faking it if you say you’re depressed and don’t believe in managing with medication. I’ve been on my own for about 2 years now and have started going to the doctor for the first time in 7 years. I decided to go to a psychiatrist because of some issues I just can’t take anymore. I was diagnosed with OCD which kinda confused me as I don’t know too much about it. I haven’t been able to get more than 3-6 hours of sleep for two years. My brain won’t shut off and I have racing thoughts about things I need to get done that are stressing me out or scenarios that could happen, concerns about my brother and his family, concerns about my future, my dog, past experiences that I read into and wonder what they’re emotions towards me we’re. I am so tired but just can’t sleep. I’ve tried lots of things except prescription meds because I wanted to get the source. It’s takes me about 3 days of no sleep for me to randomly be sitting on the couch or in a chair and I’ll wake up to my Partner saying "you were asleep like that for 3 hours". If I clean for long hours, basically exhausting myself, I’m able to lay down and sleep for about 6 hours but I wake up on the hour with my heart beating like I’m anxious. I feel like most the time I have no personality or purpose and nothing brings me joy. Then I randomly get these bursts of energy like I can’t sit still have to clean or run and there a million thoughts going through my head and I feel like I could be some big shot CEO and build a house 😂 something my partner pointing out was that if someone says something or something happens that give some even the slightest negative emotion I just spiral and start thinking about how hopeless I am. I am so mentally exhausted and the only thing that keeps me going is that I have to be here for my partner and my pup dog. I repeat to myself that I just need to bite my tongue and wait this out until I have burst of energy and happiness again. I am also very organized. Not in the head, that’s all over the place 😂😅 but my room is spotless and precise and I can’t live without my multiple notebooks that I write lists for everything in/journaling. I’ll write a list of things to do when I’m hyper and then feel so overwhelmed and unmotivated after that hyper feeling goes away. I’m only a little bothered with germs, I don’t let my partner kiss the top of my hand, touch my face, or I’ll clean his cup really well so there’s no germs on it. I’m just worried that he might get sick. I definitely get really anxious over talking to people but as soon as I do I become this charismatic person that knows how to ask the right questions and keep the person talking about themselves to make them like me even though I find talking to people kind of unbearable:/ I apologize that this is so long and I appreciate anyone who reads this or even makes it this far. I’m also Sorry it’s all over the place 😅 This is my first time being diagnosed with anything/seeking help. My family never hugs or says I love you so talking about emotions feels wrong and I’m nervous about this whole process. I’ve been prescribed Fluvoxamine and have a follow up in a month so we’ll see how it goes!

title: Propranolol for people without high BP and HR
content:
Hey guys, like the title said I was prescribed 10mg propranolol for my panic which usually is made worse by physical symptoms like heart palpitations, nausea, and tremors. However, as title says, my heart rate and blood pressure tend to be normal and stay within normal range. My anxiety is telling me that I shouldn’t take the propranolol because it would be dangerous, but also I have taken it twice now successfully and I think it helped, but I keep getting scared to try it again. 

Anyone else in the same boat but take propranolol?

title: I need help Jo
content: So I’m 17 almost 18 I have bad social anxiety and today I got onto Fortnite with my boyfriend and his friends 4 other people so there was 6 people playing (he lives 10 hours away never met his friends in person only him) we have been dating for almost 4 years now but recently I got asked onto the game by two of his friends let’s call the A and F. These two are really nice and we are planning on moving in with them at the end of the year. But M and E aren’t as nice. When we were playing the game I kept feeling left out I was to scared to talk so I stayed muted I wanted to talk but I didn’t know what to say after M and E kept saying I wasn’t any good (which I know I wasn’t but it seemed like it was being rubbed in my face over and over) I got even more overwhelmed and had an anxiety attack while I was just trying to have fun. In April im going over to where my bf lives to go to prom with him and his friends.we talked about it and he said that it could be just us but I know he wants to go with them also we planned before this to be at prom for like 30 minutes to and hour and then all of us go out to dinner but now I feel uncomfortable,I want him to have fun with everyone since ik he’s been looking forward to it but now I’m even more scared they will judge me or dislike me I just don’t know how to go about it anymore I still want to go to dinner and everything but I feel like I’m just gonna be in the way or end up feeling left out and I really want to have fun on prom specially since I only get less then 5 days over at my bf house how do I make sure I don’t feel left out and what do I do so I don’t ruin prom for my bf (he keeps saying that even if it was just us he would have just as much fun as with his friends but I don’t want him to not have fun with his friends) im also not ever good with social interaction I don’t know when someone is joking or just being mean I always take it as them being mean. I only really have 1 friend we only talk every once in a while I’m not a different person to get along with I don’t think but I don’t know how to talk to people so i don’t really talk to anyone but my bf  so I want his friends to at least like me a little

title: Time Anxiety
content:
This is mostly just a question, if anyone can relate to having severe anxiety over time related issues or being late to places. 
My entire life I’ve always found myself stressed over time, counting minutes and seconds, almost anticipating something, even if nothing was really going on. 
My biggest fear is being late to things. Even if it’s small. It gets so bad that I’m arriving to places hours before I need to be there. 
I’ve been thinking about this a lot, and I wonder if it can stem from childhood. When I was a kid, I played lots of sports and if you were late to practice the coach would make you run laps or some kind of repercussion for being late, even if you weren’t old enough to drive yourself to practice. Why did the coaches do this? Or did this happen to anyone else?I’m wondering if this was possibly the start of my constant time counting or if it was just a contributing factor. Can anyone else relate to this?

title: Nothing helps, exposure and desensitization are making it worse
content:
I don't know why exposure therapy and desensitization don't work for me. 

I've been anxious all of my life. It has never gotten better. Every year, my anxiety is worse than the year before. Every year, I can accomplish less than the year before. 

For example, driving anxiety. I've been driving for 10 years. 5 days a week, around 1h every time (work). It doesn't get easier. I am more scared every time. In my head, it's not "Oh look, I didn't have an accident in 10 years, it's not as scary as I thought". It sounds more like "Everyday I don't have an accident brings me closer to the day it will happen". 

It's like that with everything. My anxiety clings to everything, every little detail, every sensation, every information. The list of everything that makes me anxious gets longer everyday. It does not get better. There is not one thing I can think about and tell myself "I used to be so anxious about that, but it's better now". 

I am medicated, I have tried many meds. I have regular therapy sessions, it's been the case for the last 9 years. I don't know how to hope for a better future.

title: I wish I could turn back time. Please help me.
content:
I was curious about how intrusive thoughts worked so researched a little bit about it. I saw some posts about people needing help with controlling sexual intrusive thoughts and that’s when my life took a down turn, Ever since I read that post I imagined how awful it would be to have those thoughts and from then on, I’ve made those thoughts my own and it’s making me miserable.

Now I see everything sexual in nature and it’s so disgusting it makes me want to cry. Up until that point I was doing perfectly fine. I regret ever reading that and I’ve been beating myself up about jt every day. If i just didn’t read that single post I wouldn’t be suffering as much as I am right now and it makes me so, so, so upset. What do I do? I don’t know anymore I have so many regrets.

title: Overly Paranoid over side effects of SSRIs
content:
For context I’m currently on Lexapro (10mg) and on Day 8.

Is anyone else awfully paranoid over the side effects that you either hyperfixate or jump between them? Especially after reading horror stories online.

For example, I know that though rare, you might feel suicidal, but because you’re anxious you immediately focus on it and actually wonder if you’re feeling that side effects. 

Or you feel happy=hypomania=undiagnosed bipolar.

And then the good old spiral happens, where you wonder if the medicine is working or is even for you etc.

title: Extreme heart anxiety.
content: I am really suffering from heart anxiety. It’s like the symptoms get worse. Right now I have coming and going aching and sharp pain I neck, (idk could be posture), achy back pain, very bad chest pain, intense sharp or achy, coming and going arm pain, shortness of breath like all the time, constantly checking my heart beat, it feels all the sudden like weak and more faint then it used to, and I’m starting to feel unwell I was getting lots of cold sweats today and I can feel it in my nose it’s like kind of stuffy and it burns to breathe in a little. I’m really posting this for someone to relate to ALL of this. I just feel alone. Really alone. I am 14 though so it’s less likely to have a heart attack. But still.

title: Anxiety with sick pet
content:
I have been working through an anxiety program for over 8 weeks now and I was doing great and then today my dog started acting upset and off and I'm scared. There are no obvious symptoms, just getting upset randomly throughout the day and wanting to be in my lap. This has happened before, and I have spent thousands over the last two years with different vets, tests, and none have been able to diagnose her and I can't afford anymore but it is making me so sad and anxious that she is obviously upset and I can't help her. I don't know what to do. I am struggling with wanting to research and fix it even though I don't know what I'm looking for, and my mind won't stop going around and around I have been thinking about it all day, I can't shut my thoughts off. Everytime I see her I get a wave of fear and then I feel even more guilty, and the panic makes me want to run, go literally anywhere else. I feel like she needs me and I am failing her. I feel like if I could afford one more vet, maybe that one would be the answer and because I can't it is my fault. I don't know how to get through this again. I know all of the 'steps' to take - relax, breathe, meditate, reduce stress, mindfulness techniques, positive thinking. That's all great when there is no reason for the anxiety. But what about when there is something really wrong and you can't do anything? How do you get through the day, pass the time? I can't focus, I've lost interest in everything I usually enjoy, it seems like torture. 
I'm not scared of the anxiety, I'm scared of losing her, of having her possibly suffering and being unable to help.

title: Was this rude or am I crazy?
content: I went to see a psychiatrist this morning. She seemed pretty uninterested in everything I had to say from the get go so I just gave cliff notes about what’s been going on with my noggin recently. In the end she diagnosed me with OCD. When she was asking questions she asked "Do you hoard?" In a very blunt manner. I replied with "kinda a little. My parents are hoarders😂" and I laughed trying to make light of the conversation because I was honestly uncomfortable talking about my issues. But what I’m posting for is the fact that she said "That’s not what I asked you. DO. YOU. HOARD.“ and I’m gonna be real I swallowed and held back tears. That really hurt my feelings and messed me up all day today. Am I just sensitive? She seemed so annoyed with me and I’m not sure if this is just me over thinking :(

title: SSRIs that don’t cause weight gain?
content: I’ve been on Zoloft for 5 years. Started gaining weight around 6 months after being on it. Ended up gaining 70 pounds over 2 years. Never had trouble keeping weight off before Zoloft. Went on Ozempic, lost 90 pounds (yay) but insurance stopped covering it so now I’m worried about gaining back on Zoloft. My primary doctor suggested Wellbutrin, but it seems like that’s only for depression and can make anxiety worse. SNRIs are out because I’ve had horrific side effects with Effexor, Viibryd, and Pristiq. Are there any SSRIs that don’t have a weight gain side effect??

title: Worried about the whole world
content:
Sometimes I get these bouts of **severe**, free-floating anxiety.  I'm worried about everyone and everything, including the state of the world and the future of the planet.  If you follow the news, there's no shortage of things to worry about.  There's racism, xenophobia, hate crimes, gangs, criminality, poverty, homelessness, global warming, drug abuse, the opioid epidemic, mass shootings, nations being ravaged by wars and conflict, and it seems people are always looking for some reason to hate each other.

As a highly sensitive person, I absorb and internalize everything, and it's very overwhelming.  I have a million things to worry about!  How can anyone possibly find peace in a world like this?  Any minute, something TERRIBLE could happen!  Eventually the anxiety runs its course, and some form of faith and spirituality kicks in.  I realize that worrying myself to death is not making the situation any better.  Does anyone else have this experience or go through this routine?

I reviewed the subreddit rules.  r\anxiety aims to be politically neutral and it should be.  So, I don't want to fixate on any of the things I mentioned.  My point is about anxiety surrounding everything going on in the world.  Part of the problem is that I care too much.  I'm also a worrywart.  I think I "enjoy" worrying.  Even when nothing is going wrong in my own life, I go *looking* for things to worry about.

title: Bad Anxiety That I Can’t Manage (Kind of an Update to my Previous Post)
content:
I previously posted about my bad coping habits for my anxiety. Since then, I quit my job, and I talked to my doctor about medications and was prescribed a medicine. It seemed to work! If my anxiety got too bad, I took one, and calmed down in time. My anxiety seemed to be less frequent due to no stress from work, and when I did have it, the medicine paired with healthier coping mechanisms seemed to make it manageable.

Today I started back at school. I’ve been out of school for years for this exact reason - anxiety and depression made it too much. But I decided to go back, because I don’t want to be stuck working minimum wage jobs that don’t pay enough to support myself and move out and all. However, it’s day one, and it’s already going terribly…

I’ve had six panic attacks today, in less than twelve hours. During my second attack, I took my medicine, it helped for a little, and then… BOOM. Another stressful thing happened and triggered it again, and I couldn’t stay calm. I’m supposed to only take my medicine once every six hours as needed, so obviously I didn’t take a second one when I’d literally JUST taken one thirty minutes prior. I continued to have my fourth panic attack, got through it, and then… about four hours after taking it, a fifth panic attack. I decided to try and take a second dose, since it had been a while and I’m in the lowest dosage, and well… it wasn’t helping. So I went back to my old habit of self harming, and that calmed me down for a bit… until I had a sixth one just now.

What do I do? I don’t know what to do. Why does nothing help? I can’t drop out - I’ve already taken thousands out on a student loan. I can’t not have a job. I need something to work to support myself. But what?

Why does nothing help me? Why does everything make me anxious? Why do I have panic attacks so bad that I can’t breathe, can’t speak, can’t move - can’t function or do anything at all? Why can’t I get through this? Why can’t I function in society like a normal human being? What am I doing wrong?

I need help but I don’t know what to do. Why doesn’t anything ever work for me? I can’t take this anymore.

title: Got back into fitness to help my anxiety, but now its causing me more anxiety
content:
I recently have been making healthier choices in order to manage my anxiety after Medications have failed and therapy is too expensive to go to besides every 3 weeks. I started to incorporate exercise back into my routine today. I am very active at work, i walk about 20k steps and lift things that are 40-50 pounds occasionally, but i figured i would benefit from extra movement. I used to weight lift pretty intensely 3 years ago and since then random work outs maybe every few months. Today I did a youtube video of mat pilates with 8 pound dumbell. It was 30 mins and i was sweating and it was challening but not difficult. Now i am lying in bed, starting to feel sore, scared I have Rhabdo forming. 

I of course googled, and onr thing that causes it is jumping into workouts after not working out for a long time. Im now terrified of developing rhabdo and dying. How am i suppose to continue to work out for my mental health, if it just causes me anxiety?? Anyone struggle with this?? Sorry fkr the long post, im just scared. 

TLDR: Started working out for my anxiety. It has now caused me intense anxiety about Rhabdo.

title: how to get over the heart attack/stroke fear?

It’s so hard to convince myself I’m not dying everyday especially when I have so many other symptoms to go along with it. I’ve been checked out by multiple doctors and the results came back clear every time. It’s exhausting being in pain every day and not knowing the cause for it. I’m only 15 so I know I shouldn’t be worrying this much but I can’t help it. :(

title: anxiety attack heart rate 157bpm
content:
I (25f) got a fitbit a few days ago- to look at my daily steps and do some stress management.

I’ve been doing EMDR to address my anxiety and trauma but have taken a break for a few months over NYE. I thought my anxiety was really manageable and doing much better since therapy. 

I work a corporate job which is usually pretty boring but have been having issues with one side of it and in particular a colleague that is incapable and really difficult to work with.

The situation had been building for a few days and hit a boiling point today where they spoke to me in a very aggressive way in front of other people. 

I shut down and removed myself from the situation, I felt my body go into fight or flight but was mostly able to de-escalate.

I looked at my heart rate which is usually 55bpm resting, and saw that it spiked to 157bpm while I was sitting down. For some reason seeing this physical data and proof of the physical symptoms I can experience is so profound? 

On one hand I’m so upset that I’m feeling this anxious again, and on the other hand in awe that I’ve been able to get through life on ‘hard’ mode- using simple tools to manage this mental illness. 

I definitely have a long way to go, but through therapy I’ve decided I wont put myself in situations with people that are bad for my mental health, whether thats a family member or a colleague. 

Just wanted to share.

title: Don't know where to start getting help...
content: Hi All, I've been stalking this page for a little while now. Long story short I think ive always struggled with anxiety but It got way worse after I got married. Don't get me wrong, I love being married and I absolutely adore my husband, he's great! But I've always been a homebody and lived with my parents until I got married. I was totally fine up until our first day in the apartment after our honeymoon. I literally had a mental breakdown for about 6 months. I couldn't be near crowds, would barely leave my house, cried all the time ,and felt nauseous 24/7. I chalked it up to taking new birth control and being homesick but 4 years later I realize this whole time I've been a ball of worry and anxiety. I used to love traveling, flying especially. I saved all my boarding tickets, even thought about being a flight attendant, and now the thought of getting on a plane gives me shortness of breath and tremors. I can't stand roadtrips either. I've been tracking my "symptoms". I've noticed that I do well with a routine, the moment I do something different, like go traveling, even if it's a weekend trip, I feel like I'm going to throw up and spend basically the entire trip super tense and nauseous, tremors, jaw clenching, etc. I've also had horrible GI issues. My husband and I are traveling out of the country in April to visit his family and it's two 7 hour flights. I don't think I'll survive it. I've scheduled an appt. With my primary care to see if I can get some medication and start therapy or something but I really don't know what to do!! Is this the right path to start on? Sometimes I feel like starting medication is almost defeat but Idk how else to get over these periods of panic.

title: mentally healthy people
content:
i find it so crazy how some people can do things like move their entire home from one house to their new one, and THEN, still be able to unpack all their items and organize them once they get to their new place ..


with no dragging of their feet, no procrastination, no lack of motivation, no racing/intrusive thoughts, no rumination, no anxiety, etc.


like they can just say they’re going to do something and then just do it

title: H pylori and general anxiety
content: I was diagnosed with anxiety a few years back...I have been able to control my anxiety and my attacks have been once in a while...but I got diagnosed with h pylori a few weeks back and after starting treatment..this last 2 days my anxiety has been uncontrollable they prescribed me hydroxyzine..Its says every 8 hours but I take them when I wake up and in the afternoon...they work but make me feel so tired and sleepy...any tips?? Thanks

title: Anxiety after dental filling?
content: Today I had a couple of cavities filled (I didn’t do it earlier because they weren’t covered by insurance). It didn’t hurt and it went well but it’s been a couple of hours since my appointment and I can feel where the cavities were filled it feels slightly bulky, I’m wondering if it didn’t set completely because the dentist was busy. The other thing I noticed is I kind of feel like my mouth/throat is a bit itchy (I checked my mouth ect is normal) but because I felt a bit itchy I started worrying about potential side effects of the fillings (they are the fillings that look like the colour of teeth, composite fillings) or like maybe they didn’t set properly? I had fillings like this 7 years ago (no issues) but these are my first fillings in a while and with a new dentist. Any experience with this?

title: Did acupuncture do anything for you?
content:
I don’t believe in acupuncture really but back when I was dealing with palpitations and a panic disorder and after being told by multiple doctors everything is normal. I decided to try it as an experiment. 

I can’t say for sure if it played a role in my recovery or not alongside exercise but it’s definitely a possibility. 

Would love to hear peoples experiences

Other new hires including myself all left within one week, I’ve had lots of jobs before but none were ever that bad and toxic but now that I’m going to start a new job within the next two weeks I’m really anxious if it’ll go my way this time, I felt like a failure quitting a job so soon but it was not worth it as other people also quit super fast. Anyone have any tips on to conquer this feeling ?

title: My dog bit me and I had a panic attack I don’t know why
content:
It happened really really suddenly. We were trying to clip his nails and he bit me, it didn’t even hurt that bad but I just started to cry and hyperventilate I don’t even know why. It didn’t even make any sense I just got struck with panic or something, it didn’t even break the skin it just pinched it and left a little red mark.

 It was extremely unexpected like I’ve been scratched and bit before but this never happened but this was a bit of a harder bite but like I said it didn’t even hurt really. Has this happened to anyone else? It was confusing lol I’m on some meds I was wondering if It could have been a weird reaction? 

I’m on antidepressant, buspirone, mood stabler, and Adderall cause I have adhd and ocd ontop of the anxiety issues.

title: HELP….Anxiety so bad can’t stay asleep
content:
So I know it’s not a good idea at all but the only thing that helps me stay asleep is my prescribed Clonozapam and NyQuil at night. 
Can anyone else relate? So I take 1 mg of Klonopin in the morning which I’ve been on for 15 years already but now to stay asleep is the problem my psychiatrist is telling me to take two Klonopin at night but that would be 3 mg daily and I don’t wanna be on that much Bentil, I tried taking one Klonopin at night and it won’t do nothing. I have to take a dose of NyQuil along with it so I can stay asleep. Otherwise I literally wake up every hour and can’t go to sleep. This is no way to live. I have a 4 1/2 year-old that I have to take care of along with my two older children who are adults. My anxiety is that debilitating due to severe past DV trauma and etc. I would appreciate any suggestions or tips of how to possibly stay asleep. I’ve tried a lot of things that people take and it just doesn’t work for me. My Dr just prescribed me Ambien 10 mg and it didn’t do a thing except make me wake up every hour on the dot I believe my gabba receptors and nervous system is so jacked up from being on the Klonopin for 15 years already. I am afraid now that what I’m doing even though it is helping it’s gonna end up messing me up severely. I already grew tolerance to the NyQuil when I was taking it for a month during the holidays just so I can make Christmas happen. I’ve been stop taking NyQuil and I was just taking Benadryl with my Klonopin, but it still doesn’t have the effect that the NyQuil does idk why, but the NyQuil along with the Klonopin is like magic except we all know what’s gonna end up happening. I’m gonna grow tolerance like I did prior. I stopped taking NyQuil for about a week, and I literally couldn’t stay asleep for 2 days. If  I don’t sleep, I can’t get anything done yet let alone take care of my home and do anything that needs to be done HELPPPP!!!

title: I fear losing my parents and I’m not sure how to deal with that feeling as an only child.
content:
Per the title, I fear losing my Mom or Dad. I’m the only child and have been raised well. I have a good relationship w/ them but live a few states away. So we get to see each other probably 6 or 7 times a year.

They are getting up there. I’m 38M, probably doesn’t matter but I’m not married. So my parents are my only immediate family and I’m always getting nervous of losing them. 

When I think about it it’s like a blanket of anxiety starts to get pulled over me. I know it’s inevitable meaning that’s the circle of of life. Just not sure how to deal w/ these thoughts.

content: I talked to a teached and they told me every 14 year old feels that way. I don’t think they do. It’s like really bad and I can’t do anything about it when it hits. It’s really limiting me and it sucks. I feel so hopeless.

content: I have this anxious feeling that my girlfriend is going to break up with me tomorrow. We last saw each other on the 19th and she's been dry on texts ever since despite being at home all day. The last time I had this feeling, I was right but it still hurt. I really love her and I don't want loose her..... I see a future with her in it.

title: anxious and depressed
content: About two years ago now I got super sick at school and haven't been better since. I have constant stomach pain and shits and it feels like I have the stomach flu 24/7. Ive been to multiple drs and even been hospitalized but they all claim its IBS. IBS sounds so stupid for how dramatic I'm being but it hhonestly has changed my life for the worse. Im scared to even leave the house with the fear of crapping myself that's how bad it is. I feel discusting and inhuman and am constantly missing out on events because of my fear and symptoms. I have so much anxiety abt getting sick in public and I even missed my own graduation. I feel so left out of life and think its not gonna get better because its been 2 years. The only things i can eat that dont make me instantly ill is rice and oatmeal, the plainest foods.Anything else with any flavour and i end up in the bathroom all day so i no longer eat normal food. Ive been on this insanley restirve diet that makes me go mad. I cant go out to any dinner parties or eat at any resturaunt. i basically h ave no more social life and stay home all the time. Ive thought about ending it many times but cant seem to do it. How can I stay alive but be happy, have no more hope pls send any thoughts. I want my life back and to go back to normal. u can imagine how anxious i am constantly...

title: Fear of starting new things
content:
I’ve nearly finished my counselling degree and i’ll soon be starting placement. I’m terrified. I’m basically scared of disappointing people, failing and just being told that i’m not doing a good job. 

Yes, i know how ironic that i’m studying counselling but i’m having panic attacks. I guess that’s why I want to help others.  I’ve been having panic attacks that involve me crying, shaking, difficulty breathing etc. the thoughts if fear and failure and the “i can’t do this” or the “what if” just won’t go away unless i’m sleeping. 

If anyone has experienced something similar, what coping mechanisms worked for you?

title: Social anxiety panic attacks?
content: My mental anxiety is pretty much non-existent, I really don’t worry about stuff that much. But the physical aspects are getting out of hand. I recently started having panic attacks? where I start gagging and sweating. I’ll go to the bathroom and it will feel like i’m about to throw up and dry heave for a while. Usually 5-10 minutes and then afterwards I get an instant feeling of relief and can usually go about my day. These happen in relation to getting certain text messages or going out for social events. I’ve been looking into propranolol recently since people say it helps the physical aspects, does anyone have any input on this? My appetite is low throughout the day too and I have little interest in food sometimes, but again my mind never really worries or gets anxious.

title: Terrified to start Escitalopram
content: I'm am utterly scared of starting this medication because of the side effects regarding wicked dreams and low/no libido. Sorry if this is TMI but being able to orgasm is such an important thing to me, I don't want one of the pleasures in this life taken away from me. As for dreams I'm already having issues with excessive dreaming.. I'm trying to not make it any worse. During the day I already deal with a lot of intrusive thoughts and the anxiety revolving it.. sometimes I can manage but today has been a hell sent in remembering some fucked up stuff from my childhood. I am talking it all through therapy and my therapist reassured me that taking it will be okay but I'm just so anxious about it all. I don't know what to do but I'm so sick of feeling like this and not being able to rest during the night/day.

title: Hentavirus
content: Currently dealing with a mouse problem. They even come out during the day or when my husband and I are walking around! The other day I noticed it looked like a big piece of mouse poop on top of one of the bowls I had sitting out to dry after doing dishes. I didn’t think much of it and rinsed out the bowl with dish soap and my bare hands. The bowl got placed back into the sink where I washed it again with more soap. I’m terrified after learning about hantavirus. I’m so anxious of getting it.

title: Fear of this feeling being permanent
content: I'm not afraid of the physical sensations ie fearing I'm going to have a heart attack, I'm afraid that I'm going to feel this way permanently/this is never going to end. I'm not even worried that I'm going crazy or getting psychosis, just that THIS is all I'll be able to feel for the rest of my life. This horrible panicky dread feeling. It's not a panic attack, but it's constant dread and doom. I'm terrified, I feel like I have no control over it. It's like my mind exists independently of me. I read Dare, but because I'm not having panic attacks or convinced I'm going to die, just convinced that this is it, this is all I have to look forward to, it feels so hard to "accept it". I feel too scared of it to accept it. I feel hopeless.

title: How long does your shortness of breath last?
content:
Sometimes I get air hunger tied to an obvious stressful thing. But other times it just comes and stays for hours. It feels horrible and like I'm having a health issue. Affects me while doing mild exertion, etc. Usually if I can force myself to run or stationary bike, it settles out.

Anyone have the same?

title: I’m so tired of living like this
content:
I (23M) have moderate/severe anxiety. I have since I was a kid and it was bad in middle/high school and college, but once I graduated got a bit better. Now, I am a full time worker. I work in a school doing tech and I love my job. I like the people I work with and I enjoy what I do, but every morning Monday-Friday I wake up and the first thing I do is throw up. It is not that I am sick either, it is just I am so anxious that I throw up.

Now this is my fault, but I stopped taking my medication about 4 months ago and have been not on medication since (yes I know that is bad). I cant start back on my meds, though, because it makes me sick. I feel like no matter what I do I will be sick. I’m out of options and I’m so tired of it.

title: How long?
content:
Hi! 

Since my last update, its been some time say maybe weeks i had bad panic and anxiety attacks. 
Thankful however, what i hate are this feeling of impending doom, weird anxiety feeling lingering intermittently. 

You know, the kind of ‘the attack is coming’ kinda feeling? Still lingering, has been days. I tried to shake it off with happy thoughts yet it still come across my brain. 
And also, after the bad attacks i had previously, i find that i am now uncomfortable to be alone at home. 

Mind it, i used to be HAPPY and okay to be alone at home, but now, i dislike greatly being alone. I’m scared? I’m not comfortable? Heck, i dont even know what i’m feeling. 😅

Anyone gone thru this? 
Thank you for reading 🙌🏽

title: Called in again
content:
So I have a good paying job, been there for 6 years.  In the last year I've developed extremely high anxiety around going to work.  Every morning wake up with racing heart and dread.  Try to always justify calling in.  Work has been lenient with me the past few months but my missing is becoming a problem.  I'm terrified I am going to lose my job and I am the one who supports my family financially and cannot lose my job.  

When I get to work I feel like I can't eat, get excessive phlegm in my throat and am miserable.

title: So anxious I can barely eat—foods that are easy to get down?
content:
Like the title says, I’m so fucking anxious these days that I’m really struggling to eat. Everything sounds disgusting; and when I am able to try to eat, I can barely swallow—I just chew and chew because I feel like I’ll throw up if I swallow. 

This is particularly bad for me for two reasons: 1..I have a history of disordered eating. 
2. I am training for a marathon and do not want to be in the kind of calorie deficit I’m in—I’ll get hurt soon at this rate. 

What do y’all eat if this is something that happens to you? 

FYI: I’m even having trouble with protein shakes—really need protein but I’ll take any kind of suggestion at this point! 

Edit: I’m so grateful to all of you for these responses. This is really hard and I’m grateful for the support.

title: I struggle so much at work
content:
I recently got a new office job after a very long period of unemployment due to anxiety and it’s a very fast paced environment. I realised I’m just unable to cope with the demands and high stress levels, and I find myself being unable to think critically or make decisions independently, probably made worse by my anxiety as well.

I’m about 1 month into the job and I’m thinking of quitting to find a job that’s more suitable for me. But I honestly don’t know what would work for someone with severe anxiety. I feel like if I give up now I’ll never be able to find a job again. 

I think my coworkers are also sick of me asking questions and I can tell from their tone that they think I’m stupid. I feel depressed and I often feel like ending my life so I don’t need to worry about all of this anymore. I think I’m just useless.

title: I don't know anymore what to do with my life . Please help !!!
content:
I am 23(F) and I just don't know anymore what to do with my life . I completed my bachelor's degree in 2023 then took a gap year to prepare for the entrance exams for postgraduate colleges.  Well gave the exam and guess what didn't crack it idk anymore what to do . I have other friends who also didn't do well but now no one Is talking properly I understand they are also unhappy about their results.  My parents well my father didn't talk to me properly like didn't respond properly when I asked him something after I told my results and my mother talks with me but you can tell she is upset sometimes won't respond to me . Whenever we talk about some topic , my mother will definitely bring the topic of colleges,  jobs . There is too much pressure for work now . According to My parents specially my mother I didn't get into college now what to do I am aging and I need to find a job fast Start with college as soon as possible then get placed and start working . Whenever I am telling that I will give another shot at the entrance exam she is like " what are the chances that next time you will definitely crack the exam " it feels like she doesn't even trust me anymore she doesn't have any belief that I will be able to crack the exam.  Now she is saying just see colleges which take direct admission and everyday all day she will talk about this . 

I understand that my parents are stressed and thinking about my future but so am I . I'm also stressed and I'm also scared about my future . Idk anymore what to do I'm just so tired of everything.  Whatever I do there is some obstacle or I won't succeed in that . Thought of doing some investments but don't know anything about it there are videos on youtube but they all mainly sell the courses.  Thought of doing some freelance work then Thought pops up what if I don't succeed . Tried doing youtube no views for first few videos then got copyright.  It's like universe , God just doesn't want me to be happy or succeed in life . 

How much more I have to struggle Ik this is nothing but for me the failures are struggle I'm slowly loosing hope from everything I just don't know anymore what to do . 

Sorry for yapping so much just needed to get it off . If anyone has read till here then feel free to give any advice or if you want to say anything you can .

Thanks guys! :)

My fucking legs are shaking, and my heart is at 100 bpm just typing this shit out and thinking about posting it. 

So how am I supposed to do this shit

Edit- Medication

title: Stressing about a presentation i have in 2 days
content: Hello people, like the title says I've got a important presentation coming in 2 days. I need to present it with 3 group members in front of my class and i need to talk approximately 4 minutes. Normally this would not have been a problem but since the start of this school year I've suffered from terrible stage fright. Its new to me and it scares me so fucking much. I have powered through 2 presentations with it but they were both shorter (around 1 minute) and less important. I almost got a anxiety attack in front of the class but managed to barely stay calm, but im worried that i wont manage this time. The presentation is longer and as soon as I step in front of my class my heart start pounding and I start sweating and shaking profusely. This affects my performance and I am scared that I will let my group down but more importantly I will freeze in front of the class from fear and embarris myself really bad. I absolutely have to go and it is stressing me out really bad 2 days in advance. Its fucking up my sleep and I know that that will just make the fear worse. I have gotten a few tips from my doctor but I don't think that will be enough. My current plan is bringing a water bottle full of alcohol to school and drinking some beforhand to soothe my nerves. I know that that is a terrible solution but i really dont want to fuck up in front of my class so it seems like the only option. If i screw up I will be hearing that for a long time in my class. Does anyone have some tips for soothing my nerves beforehand, but most importantly stopping that discharge of adrenaline that I seem to get instantly. I cant deal with it in front of my class, it really scares me and it clouds my thinking so I wont be able to perform as well. Thanks for your responses and I will let you know how it went afterwards.

title: Cardiophobia
content:
TW: Cardiophobia F21
I try really hard to believe my doctors when they say nothing is wrong with my heart. But then I have things happen to me and its so hard to believe nothing is wrong. Like just now, I ran up stairs and my chest started feeling tight, unusually tight, it felt like my heart was being pulled from all different directions and was palpitating like crazy. I checked my blood pressure and it was 148/91 and my heart rate was 116. My heart palpitates a couple times a day and my chest always feels tight. In 2024 I had ALL kinds of imaging done, 5 Chest Xrays, 1 Heart Stress Echo, 1 Heart Echo, 1 Two Week Heart Monitor, 8 Heart EKGS, 1 Chest CTA, 1Chest CT, I also had two abdominal CTs due to appendicitis. But I still feel off all the time like something is wrong with me. Even when I am calm I still feel “off”.  Now I am sitting here debating on going to the ER because once my heart just did that I am now terrified I have a heart problem or will just drop dead.

title: Anxiety lasting after event has happened?!?!
content: Sometimes even after an events has happened that i’ve been anxious about i will still be anxious hours later and i don’t know why, it’s almost like i do pretty well with the anxiety at the time of the event but then after i just like crack and become more anxious. Today i went to the dentist and had a filling and had to have local anaesthetic which i was nervous about and i generally don’t like the dentist as it makes me feel trappped. But i actually did really good before hand and during the appointment but then when i got out of the dentist i felt anxious? It’s now like 8 hours later and im still having anxiety symptoms and it confuses me so much. Like surely the logical thing would be to be anxious at the time of the appointment and during not AFTER when im on my way home and im in my safe place! Does anyone else experience anything like this?

title: Bad case of DPDR and anxiety getting worse at home?
content:
Sophomore in college. I live about 2 hours from my hometown and I visit my family every 2 weeks or so. I love my family but every time I go back to visit it seems like my depression and DPDR gets worse and I start to question if anything I'm doing even matters and I question if I'm a good enough son for my parents and I always come to the verge of tears when leaving home. I'm just so extremely worried that this condition will distance me even further from my family.

Recently for the past 2-3 weeks it's been feeling as if nothing I do matters because it'll all just be a memory someday so what's the point of doing anything at all. I've also started to obsessively question every little thought and action I have, leading to some pretty nasty intrusive/compulsive thoughts including thoughts about hurting others, especially my loved ones who I clearly love and care for very much. I always seem to wake up with a racing heart and a sinking feeling in my stomach and I'm constantly worried that I'm going to go insane over my own thoughts and act out. I'm just so anxious about whether this is going to become a lifelong debilitating thing.

This entire thing feels very physical as well and is seriously impacting my ability to experience any sort of happiness in life. Before this whole thing came on, I was still anxious but absolutely nothing compared to my current mental and physical state.

I'm looking for advice on how to treat this issue. Thanks.

title: Keep feeling anxious at work
content: None of my coworkers share any common interests with me and I don’t know why the lack of meaningful interactions is affecting me now, making me feel quite anxious. I used to do ok keeping to myself but that’s no longer the case. And distracting my mind with work, music/podcasts doesn’t work anymore.

title: Alternative treatment but my anxiety goes high at night (and wake me up at  3am)
content:
Hey guys. A few years ago I started treatment with Lexapro, sometimes 10 or 20 and now 5. At times I used Wellbutrin - which was good for energy but increased anxiety.

Between comings and goings, I was put on Depakote to perhaps treat cyclothymia.

However, I recently found a psychiatrist who is looking to provide a more alternative treatment.

The idea is to reduce all medications and treat with:

L theanine 400mg + ashawaganda 600mg twice a day (I've already started)

Glycine 5g + Melissa Officinalis 600g + Passiflora 300mg + taurine 2g + melatonin 0.2mg to stimulate sleep (which has been very good, I've never slept so quickly)

Another vitamin combo

More LDN (low dose naltrexone) - I haven't started yet.

Even though I have already started the L theanine treatment with Ashwaganda and have reduced and almost stopped the use of Lexapro, sometimes I still have small anxiety attacks, for no apparent reason... at night. Sometimes i go to bed after a really good day, but i wake up at 3 am or 4 am with a anxiety atack.

Could this be a good treatment or could reducing and removing Lexapro be something that would harm me even more?

Help me!

title: Sleep anxiety
content: Wondering if anyone else has similar experiences when it comes to sleep and anxiety. When I was younger, I loved to sleep to put off my anxious thoughts, but as of late any time I even think about bedtime, my heart starts to race, and my body almost feels chilly. It feels like my body is vibrating, and I don't feel as present in my body if that makes any sense? This feeling only happens when I think about sleep, or as time gets closer to needing to sleep. When I go to lay down, I feel like I have to hold my breath and I tighten every muscle in my body. It almost feels like fight or flight response. I never had this issue until a couple months ago and I cant think of anything that would have triggered it. Does anyone else experience anything like this, or any anxiety revolving around sleep?

title: 17 and extreme stress
content:
I’m honestly the most stressed I’ve ever been in my life right now. I started online school a few months back because my anxiety got so bad I could only go to school around 1 day a week, but tomorrow I have to go in to complete some practical work for my exams. because school was the source of my anxiety and because I haven’t been there for so long, I literally forgot how bad my anxiety could actually get so quickly. because I was by myself at home I forgot about how sad and depressed I felt for months. my throat is already closed up and thats something I havent felt in a long time. waking up nauseous every morning, not able to eat and crying the night before a school day was normal for me for years and that makes me so sad to think about now. looking at photos my school posts and seeing everyone so normal and capable of just.. attending is such a deflating feeling. such a simple thing, but not for me. I already decided after typing this out that I’m not going to go in and I would much rather loose out on the exam marks than feel like this for even a minute so it’s decided and I’m literally typing this with snot everywhere from crying for the last 15 minutes how am I ever going to pass my final exams without antidepressants that work

before people start commenting things yes I have a designated clean study space, yes I fixed my diet, yes I went to multiple doctors for a medication to help (first one wouldn’t prescribe anything because I was under 18, and the second one let me try lexapro which had no effect whatsoever so he took me off it and suggests I “pick up a sport”), I even started journalling recently but none of these things help me long term 

I think whats wrong is I have celiac disease which is causing over 35 symptoms in my case and the worst is anxiety, but my doctor is not very helpful 

literally every single “remedy” you name it I’ve tried it. magnesium and iron supplements, ashwaghanda supplements and drops, lions mane drops, rescue remedy, I discovered that I’m low in vitamin B and D from a blood test at the doctors so I’ve been taking those for a few months, I added things like chia seeds and apple cider vinegar to my diet daily, removed processed sugar, and after all of this nothing helped, lexapro only gave me night sweats and extremely violent gory nightmares

I have an appointment with a gastroenterologist soon so hopefully I’ll figure out what’s causing my anxiety and I can move from there

title: I give up I think, I just don’t want to have this anxiety anymore
content:
I’ve had an anxiety for the last 2 and a half weeks at this point and today I was nearly done with it, like I played it in my head countless times and now I finally found a good way of countering it! 
Then when I felt better it started again, this time something slightly different but very much the same 
I’m scared I made a mistake 2 years ago from which I can’t come back from, which will make me a bad person/monster and unworthy of love   Forever

I do have a therapist yes but he only said that I should distract myself and then it would go away, I get his point but it’s not just any fear, it’s THE fear, the fear that ends it all if it wins

I’ll try to explain that to him tmr but I doubt he will listen 

All I want is to be a good person and to be loved by a gf and maybe a few friends who I’ll tell how much I love them for the rest of time bc they are so amazing and I’m scared I won’t ever get that so yeah, it’s tough rn

title: "Mechanical OCD"
content:
Over the past few years ive delt with this and idk if that is what its called but thats the best word i can think of to describe it. Basically anytime i use any sort of object there is a chance ill get super worried i used it wrong and ill have to go back to it and use it over and over until it feels like ive used it right.

For example sometimes ill have to...

Turn on and off the lightswtich over and over

Relock the door several times when leaving

Open and close the fridge to make sure its sealed



These are just a few examples but recently ive had a really bad obsession regarding plugging in electronics. Any time i have to do it im paranoid i pluged the cord in wrong and that the connectors arent lined up somehow resulting in the port being broken. When i feel this way i have to replug in the device several times before it feels right. I have to make sure it is flipped the right way, lined up with the port and that the right ammount of force is used, if not ill have to unplug it and try again or else i risk the device shorting out while im gone wasting me hundrends to thousands of dollars.

Im aware of how crazy this sounds but im having a hard time talking myself down from this to not worry about it. Ive plugged in electronics all my life and this has never crossed my mind until i had a random thought about it a few years ago.

(Im aware i might be told to get therapy, i vant afford it rn and looking for strategies to help myself till i can)

title: DAE get this feeling? icky jolts of uncomfortable sensations and dread
content:
i’m really trying to think of how to best describe this feeling but it’s really difficult to explain. i have this sensation where i will just be so uncomfortable for no reason. like i will see a word or see a photo and something just feels “not right” somehow?? and i will get this icky/doom/dread stomach sinking feeling of discomfort for like 5 seconds. and it’s hard to pin point anything in particular because it happens with literally anything. i could look at a doorknob and find a way to make myself have a weird uncomfortable sensation because of it for absolutely no reason at all. i mostly experience this mentally but in my stomach a little bit too. i probably sound insane trying to explain this but its almost like a feeling of being overwhelmed but it lasts about 5 seconds each time but it happens several times an hour.

it started getting 10x’s worse after starting buspirone and i stopped taking it as of today but i am so scared and want to know if anyone else with anxiety gets these weird almost “zaps” of uncomfortable thought loops/anxiety sensations that are basically out of your control and for basically no reason or explanation/sense behind it.

title: Fear of becoming a mom.

title: Lexapro to Zoloft, no taper?
content:
So I see a regular GP and a therapist, but they've farmed out my anxiety meds to a TeleHealth provider. We've been having online video appointments for a few months now, and determined that Lexapro isn't really helping me anymore. I've been on it 18 years now and while it always worked somewhat, it seems less effective now. 

So we agreed to a switch but she says I should just stop Lexapro and start Zoloft, straight up. I always thought there should be a taper but I'm not a prescriber or doctor. 

Any thoughts on this transition?  Thanks.

title: Am I just panicking
content:
Need some advice

I’ve had dpdr since September 2023 from a bad weed experience where I hallucinated and had a massive panic attack. When I first got it I had the same symptoms I did now constantly feeling like I’ve got loads of adrenaline and convincing myself everything is a threat and feel like nothings real. I pushed through it but I’ve always had a fear ever since of slepeing sounds dumb but I’m wondering if this is common. I’ve had really bad sleep last few weeks and was up for 30+hours on Tuesday last week. I got a 12 hour sleep after that but this week I’m panicking about whether or not I slept on Sunday I went to bed at 6:30am and slept u til 8 had bad dream stayed up for 20-30 mins went back to slepe got woken ups. Few times but got up about 4pm and went to work. Then Monday I couldn’t sleep until 6-7 and I got woken up at 7:45 by my mum and I went back to slepe for about an hour unsure whether I have slept or not. Then I left college early and went for a nap where I slept 2 hours awoke for 30 mins because I had a vivid mind of nightmare not a nightmare but just feeling like panicky in my dream. Then I went back to slepe for another 2 hours after being awake for 20 mins and same thing. Then I stayed up from that nap at 12-5 then stayed up until 1:30 because I was afraid of slepeing and went to sleep and I woke up about 7:30 7:45 and tried to go back to sleep for an hour until about 8:30 but I don’t think I did and it felt like I didn’t sleep but I’ve been obsessing over it all day and thinking I’m about to pass out from exhaustion.Now I’m sat here panicking and my dpdr is worse then ever making me wonder what is slepe and what if I don’t wake up or get sleep paralysis sort if this triggers anyone. But do you think I’m overthinking it and just need it relax.
