title: Lex dosage increase
content: I wanted to share my experience and see if anyone else can relate. After 3.5 years on 10mg of Lexapro, I felt like it was losing some of its efficacy. After talking to my doctor, we decided to increase my dosage to 20mg. It’s been a little over a week now, and luckily, I haven’t experienced any side effects (which I was nervous about). I’ve definitely felt some relief, but I’ve also had a few days where I still feel kind of “off.” I know it can take 4-6 weeks to feel the full therapeutic effects of a dosage increase, but I’m curious: is it normal to feel better some days and not-so-great other days during this adjustment period? I’m trying to remind myself that my brain chemistry is still changing, but it’s tough not to overthink the iffy days.

title: Second hand high from THC pen
content: Hey there, I’m having a bit of an anxiety attack right now. A little over an hour ago I was in a vehicle with the windows down with some friends who were hitting their THC pens. I’ve never touched weed because of the negative effects it could have on my anxiety. The cloud coming off of one of the guy’s pens lingered back to me in the back seat and I got a strong whiff of cannabis. Shortly after I started to feel uneasy, eventually anxious and slightly disoriented. I’m pretty sure that it’s unlikely to get second hand high. But my biggest concern is getting cannabis induced psychosis from possible contact. Does anyone have any experience with this?

title: Anxiety attacks hit me about a month ago now...
content:
So I'm going to try and go indepth about this. Just because I need some reassurance more than anything. But also to see if what I'm feeling/experiencing is normal. 

During December about two weeks before Christmas was when the attack started, two weeks before that I was working, I'm a supervisor at an ALF, I work very hands on and I experienced my first loss while working there. The patient I weren't close, but it was my floor(only started about four months ago). And I'm not sure if this a contributing factor. My father passed when I was 19, and he just dropped. From what my mom said he woke up from a nap, asked where the cigarettes were and was just gone. This is definitely something that's bothered me as I was in nursing school at the time, but I was away visiting my aunt and cousins. 

The first attack started with an intense feeling of impending doom. I think it was sparked by a video I watched right after I woke up, about an incident a paramedic had with a patient. And how they were having a panic attack, and were fighting to get out of the ambulance. And once they got their patient to the hospital they essentially dropped dead. A few hours later I had a dump of adrenaline from a game then felt this impending doom just cover me. Ended up holding on to my roommates father's leg for dear life. He's been there for me since my father passed. And he's been helping me through this. 

The next one I had was in my car, I was trying to get somewhere and I hit a red light, I got agitated and the next thing I know my heart is trying to break my rib cage, I'm hyperventilating, and my hands and feet are pins and needles to the point I got out of my car to seek help because I thought I was having a heart attack. Luckily someone I knew was in the car behind me, and they helped me catch my breath and sat with me for about 10 minutes at this light till I could drive again. This would happen again but I caught myself and started breathing through it. And manage to get to where I'm going. 

I had another come on when I took an antibiotic without eating and lost all feeling in my stomach. Ended up having an intense reaction again and nearly passed out, black reaching the edges of my eyes, whole body was pins and needles. And I'm hyperventilating again. one of my roommates gets ice and hands it to me and tells me to put it on my neck and it almost completely stops and about all of five seconds. 

Since then I've been getting better at catching the little signs of an on coming panic attack I'll go grab some ice and start breathing through it. It happens a lot after I eat, and seems to be when I have gas, like a belch will flow up my throat and make my heart flutter and I'll start to panic. A lot of my anxiety seems to be centered around my heart. 

I seem to be dissociating a lot, and derealizating as well. I'll be moving my hand and know I did that, but when I look at my hand I'm like that's not right. My back seems to be extremely tight and causes my arms to feel extremely awkward, like they are floating and not really attached to my body. I'm zoning out a lot, and seeing more spots on my vision then normal. Like when you stare at a bright light for to long and the spot the light was travels with your eye sight for a moment. Heart palpitations are setting me off too.  And while I don't feel like I'm experiencing brain fog, it feels like only half my brain is working. I've felt no real pain when these attacks happen, at least from what I can tell. 

Today I twisted while picking something up at work, and my torso hurt for less then a second and that set me off. I had a few moments of intense want to run away, and the feeling felt like it was radiating through my body. But the panic attack last about 30 mins before the feelings pasted. The first three panic attacks I had lasted hours. And left me feeling wrong for days. Even now I don't feel completely like myself. 

This is a long post, and I appreciate anyone who makes it through. I've never experienced anything like this before, and I'm terrified.

title: I often think about death my loved ones

title: I can’t tell if this is a panic attack or the sign of a possible medical condition?
content:
Something weird has been happening to me. For the past 2 years, I’ll suddenly experience what I can only describe as a panic attack while I’m flying. 

I am not scared of flying. This has never happened to me before. I began to feel dizzy, my heart accelerated and I became extremely hot. I felt claustrophobic, like I needed to get out of the plane. It came on suddenly. The feeling slightly improved standing in the aisle but it never went away. A few minutes later the pilot made an announcement that the plane had been holding and circling because we couldn’t get to our destination due to bad weather (there was no bad weather where the plane was at the moment so it had been a fairly smooth ride)

When I got off the plane, and breathed in fresh air) I immediately felt better. A few days later I tested positive for COVID after my travel partner began to experience symptoms. So I thought maybe I had gotten a fever on the plane and didn’t know it. 

But then months later, it happened to me on a plane again. And again, no turbulence, no bad weather. Suddenly at some point in the flight, it happened. And then again.

The 4th time, the plane had not even taken off, people were boarding (it was a big plane) and I suddenly felt dizzy and hot and very claustrophobic.

It’s now happened to me — the sudden rush of dizzynsss, suddenly super hot, claustrophobic feeling like I’m being stifled — few times in my car. Briefly in my room and in a hotel room (but this one is solved by getting up and just walking around for a bit and making the air cooler) And even at a busy restaurant where there was loud music. (I went to the bathroom a ton just to get fresh air and move to distract myself)

I’ve noticed in some of the situations my feet and sometimes my legs feel a bit odd, kind of like the pin and needles falling asleep feeling. Sometimes that starts before the rest of the symptoms. (And yes I do try and do foot exercises and leg exercises in the plane and when I’m sitting for a long time to try and keep them from falling asleep)

Are these just signs of panic or anxiety attacks? I just don’t understand why they’re happening. I’m perfectly fine and then feel ill. I’m wondering if it might be some type of medical condition. But it happens so out of the blue and rarely it makes me doubt. My biggest concern is on planes since I can’t actually get off a plane to get fresh air and sometimes we can’t get up from our seats.

title: Anxiety is affecting every aspect of my life and it scares me

I just want to live my life without this bullshit. I have the feeling I'm losing my mind and I don't know how to calm myself down. It scares me.

title: Taking propanolol

My doctor was very reluctant to give these to me but I managed to convince them as I have no other option. He told me to take them as and when needed. title: My job is making my life hell
content:
Hi all, 

Before I begin to rant let me just say, I am very fortunate to be in the position that I'm in and my job is decent money for my position in the UK. I work from home and can see my family all the time ( worth more than all the money in the world). I can also do my masters degree easier. 

Now for the main part. 

I had a mental breakdown back in November. This was not due to my masters degree as this is a topic that I love and relaxes me. No, my job is the reason. 

I work as an administrator in a law firm which requires to book in relevant instructions from solicitors and external clients. For the 3rd time we ( as a department) have been denied a pay rise and a bonus which in total equals between 3-5k. I was told ' my wage matches my job expectancy'. So now I am working TO that job expectancy. nothing more. 

I have been open to my manager about my mental breakdown, why hide it if they are the problem. In November they told us we have to come into the office once a month. Doesn't sound bad on paper. However, I have been working for the company for 3 years and do not know my way around the office nor do I could I pick any of my colleagues out in a line up. When I started my job all my training and any meetings have been done over Microsoft teams. I have been in the office before but that was meeting a colleague outside of the building first...  I highlighted my extreme anxiety to my manager ( whilst in tears, I may add) with the classic response 'Don't panic you'll be fine'. I spent the remainder of that same day throwing up.

On the day I had to go in the office I first say I sat in the wrong area to be told I had to move. Once I found the right place I was sat around people who did not acknowledge or speak to me in the slightest.  Later in the afternoon I found that one guy I was sat next to was a senior solicitor and he looked at me like he didn't know who I am, even though we have worked on several projects together. 

I have highlighted all this to my manager and just received a delightful email that I have to do this all again tomorrow.

I feel sick

I stress a lot as I am new and I don't like the work I am doing. I have very little knowledge in my field and won't have a lot of time to study from scratch. I can't fake or manage at my work as this is important. Previously due to the same anxiety and stress I left my job and all that converted to a traumatic experience to me. Now again I feel the same trauma and stress.I am just 26F I have financial issues and I have no addiction issues. Due to anxiety I am not able to segregate my thoughts and not able to work. I tried many methods to reduce my anxiety but nothing is helping me. I also have social anxiety and I am introverted to core. I don't know how to get help as I am new to this city. I have no friends here. I am not able to enjoy the moment I am in. I don't want this situation to lead me to depression, there is a high chance for it to happen. Please reach out to me or comment on how you guys cope up with this or let me know your ways to help stress/anxiety.

title: Chest Pain for 25 Male
content:
Hey everyone. Posting this to see if it can help with what I’ve been dealing with. I’ve now had a heavy pressure feeling in my left chest for the past month. I went to the ER in mid December due to issues with gastritis then I had to go to the ER two weeks ago because in addition to the heavy chest pain I was having a severe panic attack that caused me to believe I was having a heart attack or stroke. Good news is the EKG and X-ray were normal, but I still believe the problem is related to my heart and my anxiety is affecting my sleep and work. It doesn’t hurt when I take a deep breathe in or exercise. I also had an endoscopy done late December and they said everything was normal. I was a pretty heavy drinker on the weekends and nightly marijuana use for a few years which concerns me more. I have been under a lot of stress and have had a lot of illnesses since September. 

If anyone has ever been in the same situation or has an understanding what could be happening please let me know. I don’t want to go back to the ER and them just say it’s anxiety like they have the past 2 times I’ve been there. Anyways, thank you in advance.

title: Advice on trip with friends
content:
Hey everyone, I’ve been friends with three girls (A, I, C) for four years, and we’re in our last year of high school. For context, I’m the only one who is overweight, they are all very skinny. For as long as I’ve known them, I’ve never eaten in front of them—whether we’re at a restaurant or hanging out, I always just order water. They’ve never really asked why, except for friend A, who has commented a couple of times. I’ve always been defensive or brushed it off.

I think I feel embarrassed to eat in front of them because I’m the only one who’s overweight and I care about their opinions, so I avoid eating around them. Because of this, I’ve even turned down trips with them in the past and made up excuses, which has created tension.

Now, we’re planning a trip to a different in september 2025 after we finish our exams. I agreed to go last year, hoping that by the time the trip comes, I’ll have lost enough weight to feel comfortable eating with them. But now, I’m not so sure. C has already started planning the trip, and we’re talking about hotels and places to visit. I feel like this issue might come up soon, especially since R or D might ask some questions about my eating habits. I’m stuck and don’t know what to do. I’ve thought of two options:

1. Tell them in the near future (a few weeks or a month before the trip) about my food-related problem and how it could affect the trip. This would give them time to decide if they’re okay with it. My idea is that I could eat separately from them at restaurants, but it could be tough to find different places to eat every day.
2. Tell them right before the trip (a few weeks before), hoping they won’t mind and that they understand. I’m worried that A might have a problem with this. I would suggest the option of eating at different restaurants if needed, but I’m not sure how that will go.

I don’t really talk about my problems or feelings, so having this conversation would be really REALLY difficult for me. Out of the three of them, I’m especially worried about A because she might not be understanding and could even dismiss my problem. If she decides she doesn't want me to come anymore, I wouldn't blame her. Also, A has asked me multiple times to join trips or go to different places, but I always declined.

I would love to go, but I don't know if it's possible.

What should I do? Should I bring it up soon or wait until the trip gets closer? Or should I just drop the trip?

Thank you!

title: My psychiatrist said I was taking up other people's appointments because I made them too often
content:
I'm 22 years old male. History of anxiety disorders, depression.

I had a doctor's appointment, fortunately by phone regarding problematic, anxious dreams and muscle and jaw tension related to dreams and anxiety. The doctor said that I should distance myself, not focus on the symptoms and that I should not make appointments so often from week to week, because I could take someone else's place at the clinic. Recently, I have been making appointments every 1.5-2 weeks.

I should not focus on the symptoms, but due to the tension when eating, my jaw cracks, after getting up my jaw cracks, dreams worsen the quality of my sleep, I sometimes have headaches because of it. No, I do not have the money and time to get a dental guard for my teeth, and I have already tried store dental guards (they're uncomfortable). Besides, dental guards for teeth are symptomatic anyway, just like medications.

Of course, I am working on it in psychotherapy (CBT, for 4 months, main reason social anxiety).

Was that a good answer? After such a statement, I no longer want to participate in psychiatric treatment and I feel less important as a patient who has the right to consult with a doctor about his or her concerns about symptoms and side effects.

title: Medication tips?
content: Hi! 22f here. I struggle with severe panic attacks, I’m on the spectrum, and have OCD. I’m terrified of medication. I was in residential treatment as a teenager and was basically spoon-fed concoctions of different meds throughout the entirety of my stays in different facilities which caused a lot of negative side effects at the time. This instilled a pretty deep-rooted fear of medication in me. I didn’t feel the need to take medication since then, until last year in March when I basically had severe ongoing panic attacks for weeks. I couldn’t leave my house, couldn’t leave my bed without the fear of something awful happening taking over. Around May last year I met a new psychiatrist, she’s wonderful and has been very thorough and respectful. I finally caved in August of last year and agreed to 5mg of lexapro, which doesn’t do anything to help me…. I’ve taken so many medications in the past, and I know which ones roughly work for me, but i’m terrified to try any. I’m still stuck in a rut, although i don’t have constant panic attacks, my anxiety levels are constantly elevated and i hardly leave the house. I want to get over my fear of medication, bite the bullet, and accept it, but i can’t seem to get over that mental roadblock. :(

title: Levosulpiride 50 mg prescribed for GAD and digestive issues...

She said that until I do something for the anxiety, my stomach issues are here to stay. So, she gave me levosulpiride 50 mg (pridogen) twice a day along with some stomach meds. I read online, and it said that this med is for seizures and stuff, which kinda scared me.

Thank you so much!

title: I can’t tell if this is a panic attack or the sign of a possible medical condition?
content:
Something weird has been happening to me. For the past 2 years, I’ll suddenly experience what I can only describe as a panic attack while I’m flying. 

I am not scared of flying. This has never happened to me before. I began to feel dizzy, my heart accelerated and I became extremely hot. I felt claustrophobic, like I needed to get out of the plane. It came on suddenly. The feeling slightly improved standing in the aisle but it never went away. A few minutes later the pilot made an announcement that the plane had been holding and circling because we couldn’t get to our destination due to bad weather (there was no bad weather where the plane was at the moment so it had been a fairly smooth ride)

When I got off the plane, and breathed in fresh air) I immediately felt better. A few days later I tested positive for COVID after my travel partner began to experience symptoms. So I thought maybe I had gotten a fever on the plane and didn’t know it. 

But then months later, it happened to me on a plane again. And again, no turbulence, no bad weather. Suddenly at some point in the flight, it happened. And then again.

The 4th time, the plane had not even taken off, people were boarding (it was a big plane) and I suddenly felt dizzy and hot and very claustrophobic.

It’s now happened to me — the sudden rush of dizzynsss, suddenly super hot, claustrophobic feeling like I’m being stifled — few times in my car. Briefly in my room and in a hotel room (but this one is solved by getting up and just walking around for a bit and making the air cooler) And even at a busy restaurant where there was loud music. (I went to the bathroom a ton just to get fresh air and move to distract myself)

I’ve noticed in some of the situations my feet and sometimes my legs feel a bit odd, kind of like the pin and needles falling asleep feeling. Sometimes that starts before the rest of the symptoms. (And yes I do try and do foot exercises and leg exercises in the plane and when I’m sitting for a long time to try and keep them from falling asleep)

Are these just signs of panic or anxiety attacks? I just don’t understand why they’re happening. I’m perfectly fine and then feel ill. I’m wondering if it might be some type of medical condition. But it happens so out of the blue and rarely it makes me doubt. My biggest concern is on planes since I can’t actually get off a plane to get fresh air and sometimes we can’t get up from our seats.

title: Anyone had a chest pain (radiating down to stomach) getting worse the more you walk and fine when you lie down?  I’d really appreciate views.
content:
For the past 4 days I have been feeling a weird chest pain.  It is ok when I lie down.  Ok when sitting as well.  But the moment I get up it starts being painful as if there is a stone in there.  I have a lot of bloating as well and been just prescribed peppermint oil tablets by the doctor.  It feels like all my stomach muscles are contracted constantly when standing.  Like someone is pulling all my abdomen and chest muscles down.  If I go out for a walk, the pain continues to increase and two days ago when I pushed myself a bit it gave me dizziness and a very off feeling in the head as if it hit a nerve or something.  Was scary.  Had to do long breaths going back home and rest to feel better again.  So basically I cannot walk or go anywhere. 

For background, I have been dealing with heart palpitations and dizziness.  I was told it is anxiety as cardiologist could not find anything wrong.  I am on low dose beta blockers and sertraline and doing therapy as well for the past two months.  Had panic attacks in my life before (6 years ago) these attacks do not seem anything like those ones I had back then.  

Feels like maybe bloating issue (but i have bloating which just expands my stomach usually and that’s it!), maybe a spasm of some muscle in there, or anxiety again.  

Appreciate if anyone who ever had something like this lets me know!

title: Watch out for the antibiotics
content:
TL;DR: For 26 years I finally find out antibiotics can messed up my mental health.

Recently, I have middle ear infection and took Amoxicillin 500mg x 4 for 3 days which fucked up my guts, my breathing and mental health (turns out it may be allergy because my grandma is allergy to it), then Erythromycin 250mg x 4 per day for 2 days also fucked up my anxiety too due to lots of interaction of drugs and inhibitor of CYP3A4, last one was Cefaclor 250mg x 3 for 3 days and was sent to ER yesterday due to extreme painful of ear, numbness at right side of my body, and I could't talk (but I could type), they thought it was psychogenicity and sent me back to home after lots of checking.

Today I told my ENT this problem and he said yeah it might be the problem of antibiotics, he then gave me lysozyme chloride and ibuprofen to control the pain and hope the body to fight itself. FYI I'm still hard to talk but better, ear is better, and mental confusion seems to come down a little bit.

This reminds me 3 things:

1. Last time I took Amoxicillin was 2024/11/2 because of sinus infection (probably caused by Depakote because of misdiagnosis as bipolar), 500mg x 4 per day. But at that time I was also taking Xyzal and Tylenol. My anxiety flared up so bad that I needed to take Ativan to control it, and my body temperature was constantly high but not enough to call it a fever. Later I took the evil Augmentin 1g for only 3 pills and I felt I'm dying, took the damn antibiotics out then I still felt bad but not that much, days after I was in a panic and been put back to Prozac (which probably not suitable for me bc it makes me easily to catch a cold), and changed back to Zoloft since 2024/12/4.
2. Back in my days of studying in master degrees, especially 2022\~2023, every time I took amoxicillin for flu or cold (yeah the old ENTs really like to give antibiotics for no reason), my symptoms would become worse, but I was taking Zoloft and Xanax then so the anxiety wasn't that bad (also because I was away from home so my parents won't nagging at me lol).
3. When I was a kid, I sometimes took a green and white capsule from my mom which her called "anti-inflammatory" if I had a headache or something, later did I found that it's cephalexin and known to cause anxiety and depression. I was attempted to suicide before university entrance examination because at that time I took a lot of it to combat a "drug-induced pain".

I'm taking Zoloft, Concerta and some Librium to control my anxiety, depression and narcolepsy, finally after 26 years of my life, I find out every time I take antibiotics, my mind will fucked up, and antihistamines can strangely control my anxiety sometimes, especailly if I'm having swollen shoulders. Maybe I'm always allergy to antibiotics but I don't know, and yeah SSRIs were actually developed from antihistamine so...what a strange reaction.

Edit: Sorry I'm sensitive now but why the down vote? I'm not trying to against antibiotics but just asking for help or someone has similar reaction like this, and how to deal with it.

title: Overthinking is Driving Me Crazy—Feeling Like I’m Losing My Mind
content:
Hey everyone,

Lately, I’ve been caught in this endless loop of overthinking everything, and it’s starting to really mess with my head. I keep analyzing every little detail, replaying conversations, and questioning decisions to the point where it’s exhausting. Even though I can sleep, my mind feels restless and overwhelmed during the day.

On top of that, there are moments when I feel like I’m losing it—like I’m on the verge of going mad. It’s not just stress, it’s this intense feeling of being abnormal, different from everyone else around me. Sometimes, I get so caught up in my thoughts that I feel disconnected from reality.

I know overthinking can be a part of anxiety, but these feelings of madness or abnormality are starting to scare me. Has anyone else experienced something similar? How do you deal with these overwhelming thoughts and feelings? Any advice or coping mechanisms would be really appreciated.

Thanks for taking the time to read this. Just putting it out there makes me feel a bit better already…But later on i’ll start to shit thinkkk agin!!

title: How to stop googling medicines that my psychiatrist prescribes me?
content:
Please help me.
I am suffering from GAD since a year now. I thought I got all better and my doctor put me off medications too but few days ago I experienced panic attack again and it's been a cycle. I have somatic anxiety. Currently, I'm feeling pin and needles, chest tightness, back muscles tensed, fast heartbeat. And all this spikes up when I try to sleep.

My doctor prescribed Paroxetine 25mg and  Clobazam 5mg. I was on Paroxetine for that entire one year so I was fine with it but I couldn't help but Google Cloba. I read things like it's to treat epilepsy, it can be addictive, etc etc. I got scared. I never experienced epilepsy but what if I do once I stop taking Cloba after a month?

I asked my doctor "what's Cloba for? Will I be dependent?" and he said not to take it because worrying about my medicines won't help my condition.

After 5 days of taking Paroxetine, my symptoms hasn't gotten better. I'm wondering if I should have trusted my doctor and took Cloba 5mg too. He prescribed that for a month with a review session after 10 of taking it but then due to my stress he said not to take it.

Why is it so hard for me to trust my doctor and medicines when he is nice and has never bombarded me with tens of unnecessary medicines and always encouraged therapy? How to stop Googling things? How do I handle such situations with medicines?

title: Moving across country, uncontrollable worry
content:
Hey all, this is my first time here. I read the rules and believe this is ok to post. 
I’m moving across the country (US) back to where I grew up because we can’t afford where we live any longer.

While we did move here and I have experienced a cross country move before I am just very anxious and stressed. Mostly right now about shipping our car.  The shipping company told us a range of dates and I thought I picked the one where we would have already flown in, so we would be there in time to get the car. But it’s now locked in and they tell me it’ll get there the day before or the day we fly in (we get in late that night).

I have to arrange for a friend or family member to meet the driver now, and hope there is no damage, or that my family catches it if there is. I feel like I’m inconveniencing people and I made a terrible decision and all I can do is ruminate on something bad happening or things not working out because I made this decision on the timeline. Rationally I know I did my best with the info I had and I think someone can help me get the car, and it’s just a car, but anxiety is not rational and it’s 2:30 in the morning and I can’t sleep now. I’m trying to listen to a meditation podcast but I’ve been up for a couple of hours now. What do you do when this happens? How can I let go of the outcome?
Thanks for reading. Anxiety sucks.

title: All I want to do is cry. I’m so scared to move to a new career.
content:
I was given the opportunity to work for an insurance agency by the owner/agent of the building. ~6 months ago I met her at my current job and asked about what she does and asked about job opportunities. She apparently loved me so much that she went back to her office and told everyone about me. During my interview, the few staff knew vaguely who I was based on her talking about me. About a week ago I was at my wits end at my current job. Too much on my shoulders, low staffing, cut hours. I couldn’t do it. I reached out to her over email and added my resume, reintroduced myself, and hoped for the best. Long story short I got an email back. She replied offering me an interview and the rest is history. I’m now part of their team. The only thing stopping me from joining is a license I have to complete (paid for by the owner) the staff are so friendly. 

The hours are 9-5 Mon-Fri. There’s an hour lunch from 12-1 every day. They have rescue cats and a dog who roams around. There’s a freaking shower inside the building for employees if they want to workout. Basically- this place is nice. It’s not just nice, it’s dreamy compared to any job I’ve had. But I’m absolutely terrified. 

My therapist said if she could’ve chosen any job for me in the world it would be this. She was so excited to hear about the dog and cats as well, she knows I absolutely love dogs. She joked about my manifesting a perfect job from searching for so long. My family has all told me they’re so proud. Even my brother which shocked me because we hardly talk. I feel like I need to take up this job but all I want to do is cry. Every time I try to open the exam practice I just can’t seem to get it pulled up properly. I’m so overwhelmed by the idea of changing to a new place. I’m drowning in worries. “What if it’s terrible. What if I don’t make it. What if I can’t do it. What if I cry my first day. What if?” I slammed my laptop shut in frustration after trying to get this course started. I have not been able to enjoy my life at all since this started. I am so drained. So depressed. I want to curl into a ball and die. I can’t sleep. My appetite is gone. My heart’s always racing. I just want this to stop. I want to scream. I want to scream so loud. I want to give up on everything. I’m not ready to move on but I’m never going to become anything in life if I don’t move jobs. I’ll never get a new apartment. I’ll never be able to get a dog. I’ll never be able to buy the things I want. And I don’t even care. I’d rather suffer a shitty life than go through this stress of finding comfort in an entirely new place. Nothing is making me feel better. I just sit and waste time. Comparing the time I spend sitting to how long I’d be in the office for. Losing my mind over never having worked a 9-5. I’m used to 3am shifts. Early in early out. Why does a golden opportunity make me want to give up on living?

title: Anxiety Advice
content:
First reddit post and I'm looking for general advice. I spoke with my GP today about anxiety symptoms, most of which I've experienced for years. He prescribed me 10mg of Lexapro. Though I'm not thrilled that I have another daily pill to take, I am hopeful that it will help me in the long term. 
As I understand it, it will not change my personality, but it will allow me to feel "normal" again. 
A short back story, I've always been an outgoing person, but have been very guarded and aware at the same time. The older I've gotten, the more I find myself not wanting to interact with people more than I have to. 
I am hoping that the "normal" feeling I will supposedly experience will be my outgoing/aware self. 
Any personal experience on Lexapro?

title: Cultivate your friends
content:
I've been through a rough breakup with someone I really liked and had too much potential. Also, I crashed my car, I'm struggling a bit.

I was anxious and then got depressed; I ignored any messages I received lately. Many friends appeared surprised at my place today; they started offering support and cleaning my house, helping me feel better. They said many good things about me that made me cry. I was putting myself down, and they remembered how I was and how I was seen by all of them.

They even brought some gifts, a picture of me and my car, and some candies. I love them so much. 

My message is: cultivate your friends, be nice to them, and help them. One day, no matter how you feel, anxious or depressed, friends are going to come to rescue you just because they feel you aren't right. 

I'm still heartbroken, I'm still depressed, but they did it again; they saved me. I'm gifted to have such great friends.

title: how to get started with therapy/getting help?
content:
I’ve been to therapy before, but it’s been a while, and I’ve just been full of thoughts and questions since I feel like I’m starting over.

My anxiety and depression have gotten worse. I was told before by a therapist that I was too much for them to handle/help, and it made me feel like shit. I really, really don’t want to go through that again. That would crush me.

I do feel like I need medication to handle day to day life. But do I talk to a psychiatrist first, or talk to a therapist first and ask them if they feel I need a psychiatrist? 

When or if I talk to a psychiatrist, how do I express that I feel I need stronger medication without sounding like I’m drug seeking? I’ve been on several antidepressants, and they don’t do much if anything at all for my anxiety I feel every single day.

Do I just tell them what I’ve been told I have (as far as mental health conditions) before? Or do I just tell them what’s going on currently with my mental health? I don’t know what I should or shouldn’t tell them.

(For background, I’m 22 but still live at home.)

Also with therapists, what kind of things do they not keep confidential? I don’t want people coming to my house if I talk about certain things. It terrifies me, so I feel like I need to lie to them and omit things that are really stressing me out or upsetting me. Can they force me to get admitted? Will they keep things like self harm and suicidal thoughts between us? Or would it somehow get to people living with me?

I really do feel like I need help. But I struggle with keeping motivation to attend appointments. Sometimes I feel like it’s a lost cause, I’m always going to be like this. I’ll never know what it feels like to be normal. I don’t know if it’s just me being lazy or if it’s something to do with depression. I want to feel better. But I just feel like I don’t know where to start.

title: impending doom cycle
content:
I have anxiety and ADHD, and I’m usually pretty high functional, but nowadays I’ve just felt like there’s this overpowering gloom in my life and I don’t know what to do about it. 

I got an amazing job, and it’s perfect for me. The only thing is that it’s WFH, and working at home is really taking a toll out of me. Watching a screen all day and not stepping out of my house is very draining, more than I expected. And after work, I feel so tired…. All I want to do is sleep. 

Not only that, my family is ALWAYS home, and a lot of the times it’s not the healthiest… they are clingy and just want to know everything about how i’m feeling/doing/eating/ everything. and when i DO go out, it’s usually with family. I love my family, but I’ve always felt happier when I have some sort of distance from them (like school or my previous work)

Idk… because of my situation right now I have a lot of anxiousness, and I feel like I’m self inducing a panic attack and just feel like my worlds going to end. 

Is there any tips or advice anyone can give me? How can I balance life and work? I feel like it will always be like this, I can’t see a life where I will feel calm now… and it’s hard to talk about it to the people around me bc I feel like a broken record.

title: Tried Wellbutrin for 2 weeks, doctor tells me to stop but I wanna give it one more try
content:
Hi everyone,

Prefacing this by saying that my doctor told me I can continue taking Wellbutrin for one more week or stop—it’s my decision. But with my anxiety through the roof, it’s impossible for me to decide, so I’m here hoping for some feedback from anyone who’s been in a similar situation.

Here’s my background: I’ve been on Paxil 25mg for almost two months. The first two weeks were horrible, but then it got somewhat better. I was still super anxious, though, so my doctor added Wellbutrin 150mg, which I’ve been taking for two weeks now.

Since starting Wellbutrin, I’ve felt horrible again—almost like I did before starting Paxil. My symptoms include:
	•	Severe brain fog (I literally couldn’t see shit)
	•	Forgetting everything
	•	Complete indecision (I can’t even decide what to eat, let alone bigger choices)

I told my doctor, and he advised me to stop Wellbutrin. But when I mentioned how Paxil was rough in the beginning and got better with time, I said I wanted to give Wellbutrin more time, especially because I’ve read great things about it.

He explained that it’s very rare and unusual for an antidepressant to make you feel worse before it makes you feel better. He said Wellbutrin is supposed to complement Paxil, not undo its benefits. Still, I keep reading online (and hearing from my therapist) that it can get worse before it gets better, which makes me hesitant to stop.

My doctor suggested switching to Zoloft instead, but he’s leaving the decision up to me. I’ve read mixed reviews about Paxil + Wellbutrin and Paxil + Zoloft combos—some people love them, others don’t.

Now I’m completely lost and spiraling with anxiety. I don’t want to make the wrong choice. Has anyone else been in a similar situation? Did you stick with Wellbutrin despite feeling bad at first, or did you move on to something else? I’d really appreciate your insights.

Thank you so much!

title: Does anyone else get physical sickness from stress/anxiety?
content:
At a complete loss

Hello. 26F. Starting in September I began getting sick on the exact same dates every single month. 

-September 11th I had swollen red throat, can’t swallow, headache, thought strep. Went to urgent care, negative all tests. Sent home labeled “pharyngitis,” no meds. Felt sick for about a week. 

-October 11th woke up so dizzy I couldn’t stand, headache, feeling out of it. Mucus production in nose. Didn’t go to doctor. Rode it out for few days then gone. 

-November 13th went to doctor with bronchitis like symptoms. Negative everything, chest xray clear. Given amoxicillin. Didn’t finish it because I ended up in the psych ward and they threw it away.

-December 13th, back at urgent care for reoccurring symptoms, cough I can’t shake, feeling incredibly out of it and dizzy, headache, tight chest. Negative everything tested, chest xray clear. No meds. 

Then the big one. January 8th. Woke up just like all the others, feeling so out of it. I can’t explain the feeling. I always wake up so dizzy I can’t walk to the toilet, headache, full feeling. For the next ELEVEN DAYS I almost died. Fever of 102 steady for 12 days, pulse ox below 90, one ER visit, two urgent cares, negative EVERYTHING. COVID, all flus, all streps, RSV, pneumonia, bronchitis. Negative negative negative. TWO clear X-rays. Gave me steroids and fluids in hospital, did nothing. I lost 15 pounds and couldn’t move for 11 days. Extreme pain and trouble breathing and horrible cough.

It’s now January 20th and I still can’t breathe. Extremely tight chest, even my back hurts from trying to breathe where my lungs are. Constant headache. I’ve been sick essentially not only all of January, but for the last 5 months. I begged for any meds they could give me and they gave me augmentin just to see and it hasn’t done anything. Is it asthma? Is it cancer? Is it a fungal infection? I have had an incredibly stressful 5 months, my boyfriend and I’s house burned down in August to the ground and in November we had a very public very messy breakup, fighting everyday, unimaginable stress. Is it stress? I have an ENT appointment January 29th, what do I ask for? I just want to be able to breathe. I feel like my brain is revolving around breathing. I can’t walk or run or even take my dog out for more than 5 minutes. I have anxiety sleeping and going to work, and the mucus is more than I can bare. I am terrified once I start getting better I’m going to get worse again mid febuary like clockwork. Why does it always happen on the same dates? Has this happened to anyone? I was perfectly healthy before this and now I’m sick desperate and anxious. I will take ANY ADVICE! HELP!

title: My doctor isn't diagnosing me properly but keeps giving meds. I don't know whether it's anxiety or something else.
content:
So, I have been to the doctor 3 times since last month but he just keeps prescribing me meds on the basis of what I just say for once. Now mind you, he is a popular neuropsychologist with the best rating. Last month he prescribed me lamotrigine saying that I'm probably bipolar just because I was in constant fear. I guess he assumed it due to my mother also on the same meds prescribed by him. I'm not saying he is wrong but he never asks any questions or goes into details regarding my problem or anything.

It all started around 12th of this month almost two weeks after I abruptly stopped lamotrigine prescribed by him for a month. I started getting running thoughts, remain anxious most of the day. It feels I keep thinking about my issue a lot. I don't have any sleep issues at all. But I see dreams everyday since this problem meaning I'm not getting a good sleep. Also my anxiety almost subsides after 4-5 in the evening and I feel very good after 6-7. I have again started from 25mg of lamotrigine for 5 days and 50mg for 25 days prescribed by him but still it doesn't feel much better. Is this all happening because I skipped the 75 and 100mg dose? Also the bigger problem is that I never know whether it's GAD, OCD, Bipolar or just a symptoms of withdrawal from meds.

title: Trying to deal with my nocturnal anxiety, night 1
content:
Been struggling with nocturnal anxiety specifically, for around 2 months now following my first nocturnal panic attack, after having health anxiety beforehand for about 4 years now. This is something that has always come and gone throughout those 4 years but nocturnal anxiety is a new thing for me, and like I say it was all kicked off from a nocturnal panic attack one night. 

So for the last few months I fed into it, I didn’t sleep and created bad habits for myself around nighttime. My first port of call was to fix my sleep schedule and try to get more consistent sleep, sleeping and waking up at the same time ext. This is because I know how much poor sleep can negatively affect anxiety. So I started today by implementing things that would promote good sleep. For example, less caffeine, exercising at a good time and not right before bed, walking outside getting early sunlight, not eating too late and meditating before bed. I also made sure to set an alarm to ensure I wake up at the same time everyday and I did try to go to bed a little earlier. 

And well so far so good, but not perfect. I fell asleep earlier than usual at around 12am but inevitably I woke up at around 1:30am in a slightly anxious state but far from panic, I’m writing this at 2:15am. Again getting the usual symptoms, however instead of trying to calm myself or ignore the symptoms, I actually laid in bed and invited them on to get worse, as if I wanted it to happen. I saw someone else do this and they say it worked tremendously. And it did help for sure, it definitely didn’t remove my physical anxiety symptoms but it did remove the fear surrounding them. 

So as I lay here writing this post I feel pretty okay. It’s unlikely I will be able to fall back to sleep quick but I will probably try to watch something on tv until I eventually feel relaxed enough to fall back to sleep. But this is an improvement even from yesterday when I went to sleep at 4am, the fact I even managed t get to sleep by 12am surprised me, despite the fact I woke up. 

Has anyone else got experience with nocturnal anxiety and how did u deal with it ? Does it get better?

title: Went beyond my comfort zone only to take 2 steps back
content:
I took a giant leap for myself today this week to be honest. I might have done more than I should have, I made goals and steps in the right direction to combat some social anxiety and some work anxiety.

I took myself on a 1 hour solo date to the beach after a stressful work trip/meeting, I felt sooo awkward and there was soo much anxiety. I felt like all eyes were on me and even though this week has been rough I made myself at least commit to an hour. I took my journal and a book and even managed to take off my shoes and put my toes in the water.

As I was walking back to my car I noticed a scratch on my work rental car and a flood of regret and anxiety just came swooping in. There was a note left with no information. Just all the negatives, the never doing this again, the it wasn't worth it, the intrusive dooming thoughts. Just ALL the worst case scenarios. I got back to my hotel called my boss and he reassured me the work insurance will cover the minor scratch.I have to travel tomorrow and I just feel soo down just so defeated. I don't want to leave my hotel room I just want to stay inside.

title: Inside out 2 is great for explaining anxiety.
content:
Our brains like rhythm. If we encounter stress and use unhealthy coping mechanisms, it will worsen our anxiety. However, if we use healthy coping mechanisms like deep breathing or exercise, we can create patterns to calm the mind.

If you haven't seen the movie 'Inside Out,' you should check it out. In the movie, Riley creates anxious connections when she says she's not good enough. But at the end, she uses healthy coping mechanisms and creates calm connections. The movie is a simplified representation, but it effectively illustrates how anxiety works. The more you understand anxiety, the better you can manage it.

title: I'm just so tired
content:
I apologize for the mistakes in the text if there are any, I am not a native English speaker. 

I have suffered from anxiety for most of my life and it's just becoming unbearable. I feel anxiety literally always to one degree or another. I can't remember the last time I was just relaxed. I recently saw a neurologist. I told her about my symptoms: perpetual anxiety, poor sleep, irritability, panic attacks, inability to sit still. The doctor said it's nothing serious and my nervous system is just overloaded. She gave me a prescription for pills, which I bought the same day. It's been a week now, I've been taking the medication steadily. In part, I have actually gotten better. At least I stopped waking up in the middle of the night and feeling very anxious during the day. But my symptoms haven't completely gone away, and the more I think about it, the worse I feel.

I suffer from cardiophobia, and every chest pain or high heart rate feels like the end of everything. It makes it hard for me to fall asleep. When I hear my heartbeat lying on my side it makes me anxious. I've had a hard time getting out of the habit of constantly checking my pulse and blood pressure. But I still feel like something is wrong with my heart, especially when it feels like it's fluttering in my chest. I did an EKG and it showed some abnormalities that were normal like the doctor said. I'm going to see the cardiologist again in a few days because I can't shake the feeling that the previous doctor might have missed something.

My cardiophobia started after one of my panic attacks a few months ago. Lately, I often feel like I'm dying. Even now as I write this I feel like something bad is about to happen. It scares me insanely. I literally can't just sit/lay still. I'm constantly swinging my leg, twitching on purpose, tossing and turning. If I don't, my anxiety increases dramatically. I always wake up early in the morning. It's not a slow lazy wake up. I wake up quickly, check the time, and start to feel like something bad is about to happen. I miss so much the times when I fell asleep quickly, slept long and uninterrupted and woke up rested. 

I'm just so tired of feeling all of that. I can't enjoy life because even when I feel good in my head I just randomly have the thought "what if I die now". It's like I'm constantly in my head and my whole life is passing me by while I feel anxiety again. I feel like I've forgotten what it means to truly be okay. 

I apologize for such a long text. I really needed to share what I'm feeling. Thank you to everyone who reads this.

title: Prescribed Klonopin but don’t need it
content:
Recently my anxiety came to a head about a month ago. Small details - I have been diagnosed with GAD, Panic disorder and Depression. 

I had been doing really well with managing my anxiety; practicing mindfulness, going to therapy and not on medication. Long story short - life stress was accumulating, work has been complicated and the nail in the coffin was putting my dog down.

This led to daily or sometimes two panic attacks. The final straw was having one while driving home and I couldn’t finish the drive. I had to call to get picked up and went to the doc.

I am very anti-medication for whatever reason but after talking to my GP I was prescribed buspar and colonzepam as needed. I have not taken either but for whatever reason now if I begin to panic i just moved the colonzepam nearby. 

Something about knowing that there is a way to turn it off helps me calm down on my own. Does anyone else experience this?

title: Bad anxiety in need of support.
content: I’ve never had anxiety my whole life. Never ever ever ever. I’ve been perfectly healthy did weight lifting super happy. Had my daughter continued gym time and was still fine. Got pregnancy with my son got diagnosed with hyper pots and my life went down hill. I was 200 pounds of muscle now I’m 156 skinny and feel weak. I don’t leave the house. I have bad fears. I don’t like going far away from hospitals. I constantly research medical things convincing myself it’s not POTS it’s a tumor on my adrenal glands or it’s cancer or I’ll never be normal again. I saw an episode of the Tylenol murders where a man was placing cyanide in Tylenol bottles way back when and now I’ve convinced myself everything everywhere is poisoned. I don’t eat. I don’t drink. Ever. I’ll eat 3-5 things in days. I have panic attacks every night when I go to sleep. I over analyze my body. If I’m short of breath I convince myself I have a clot. If I feel weird like palpitations I convince myself it’s a heart attack. I’ve went to er over 100 times this year. Well 2024. I’m constantly scared to leave the house. I’m terrified of everything all I do is cry. My anxiety and panic attacks are getting worse I have crushing fear and doubt hanging over me all the time. My son is 4 months and all this is ruining me. I’m 22f and lost.

title: (Repost) Survey on anxiety and mindfulness, 18+ [moderator approved]
content:
Hello everyone, I am a graduate student conducting a study on efficacy of mindfulness to manage/alleviate symptoms of anxiety. I would really appreciate it if you could take this brief survey. 

Everyone age 18+, who is struggling or has struggled with anxiety can participate, even if you have not tried mindfulness before. The survey is anonymous, and it will take you approximately 5-10 minutes.

The survey is structured as follows: demographic portion, anxiety assessment, and mindfulness practices. The survey is mostly multiple choice, and there will be a few open-ended questions.

Thanks in advance for your participation!

This is the survey link: 🔗 [https://csueastbay.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV\_dcefL3m1Ym2lap8](https://csueastbay.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_dcefL3m1Ym2lap8)

This study is carried out by California State University East Bay (CSUEB) and has been approved by the IRB. More contact information will be in the survey link.

title: Anxiety over fear of death
content:
Posting this from a burner, historically I've never had any depression/anxiety/any other mental health struggles, my life was great for the most part so maybe this comes from a fear of losing that.

With that said, a month ago when I was high, I tried thinking about what the sensation of being dead is like. I'm an atheist, and I think being dead is the state of nothingness, such as being asleep or before the time I was born. However, the issue is that both being asleep and the time before I was born came to an end due to me waking up/being born, and being dead does not have an end. This led to a panic attack until I fell asleep.

Since then, I have had recurring intrusive thoughts revolving around three themes that cause anxiety:

1. I don't know what it feels like to be dead
2. My life is great, I want to die on my own terms and not due to some accident/disease
3. I love my family and assuming the above doesn't happen, I'll be devastated when my parents pass

For the most part, the anxiety I feel is just doom and stress. However, lately it has been causing me to wake up earlier than normal, I feel a pit in my stomach, and my legs feel tense/tingly. When my mind is preoccupied with something else, I feel completely fine until one of the three thoughts pops up in my head, completely ruining my day. It's like "Wow, I feel great! It's because I'm not thinking about...". Even just thinking about this anxiety makes it worse. Furthermore, previously whenever my mind was idle, I would daydream about neutral things such as my hobbies or memories. Now, my mind is just occupied by these three thoughts and I can't daydream about anything else.

Is there a path out of this, whether its stopping these thoughts from forming, or preventing these thoughts from causing anxiety and gloom?

title: I used Propranolol for the first time last night and it was interesting ...
content:
A few weeks ago I realized that the majority of my anxiety begins with the physical feelings of it, and this spirals into more mental anxiety. I discovered Propranolol on this forum and decided to ask my doctor about it. After listening to what I've experienced and checking my heart rate / blood pressure, she determined I would be a good candidate, and she prescribed me 20mg tablets to use as needed. I took the first one yesterday at 4:30pm, and only took 10mg to just see how it felt. It honestly was great, and I noticed that upon thinking an anxious thought, my heart wouldn't get a sinking feeling like it normally does. Rather I didn't physically react at all, and just simply shrugged at the thought and let it pass. So it seems to have worked even at a smaller dosage, and I hope to continue to use it as needed, I truly think this can be a turning point with my anxiety / OCD and feel positive. 

  
However, I did want to hear other people's experiences with side affects. I'd say about 4-5 hours after taking it my stomach was upset. I know this can be a side affect, but it is also possible I just ate something weird since I did go out for lunch earlier in the day. In doing my research about Propranolol, I did see some people share their bad experiences (heart rate dropping way too low in their sleep, hallucinations etc) so because of this I had trouble falling asleep since I was worrying this would happen to me. What was weird is around 1am when I was trying to sleep, I kept smelling camp fire smoke, and it would come and go every few minutes. I don't know if hallucinating smells is a side affect, or if maybe I was just anxious about having a side affect and that is what caused it.  I had a somewhat restless night because of this, but overall I don't think it's much of an issue with the drug, it's moreso me being anxious about taking it for the first time.

Anyways, for the 4-6 hours it was in my system I can say it definelty worked for me, even at a small dosage. I am curious to try it again in a few days to see if I have some of the same issues with my stomach, but I am hoping that it was unrelated.

title: Derealization
content:
For a lot of people who till this day go through this, I would like to share my own personal experience and how I got out of this situation.

For those who don’t know depersonalization is a feeling of detachment from oneself, or a sense of being outside of one's body.

This in a short is a coping mechanism for which your mind wants to keep you safe and secure so it in a way puts you in the back and puts dp in the front.

I had my own personal experience of this about 1 month ago.

Coming off of a laced k2 trip I had seen some horrific things that even now I couldn’t explain it to you, once I had come out of the 4hour+ trip I was still seeing these things and continued to until I met dp/dr which not only made those things go away but also brought some new and scary problems with it.

At first I didn’t understand what was happening, then the panic started and freaking out, I had nobody to help me but myself and it was absolutely awful. 

Doctors recommended therapy to help better your mind and dp/dr but I never had that luxury because well for one it was so bad that I couldn’t even leave my house, isolation is never a good idea in these situations I can tell you that right now.

People looked off to me, my own home felt fake and uncomfortable, I always thought that I was about to die and couldn’t ever stop crying, the only thing I had to help was sleep until sadly it didn’t and I ended up having the craziest lucid dream.

To sum this all up for you it was not pleasant and those 3 weeks of torture felt like a bad dream come to reality. I still suffer to this day with dp/dr but not with its full capacity, there are still things I have trouble understanding and I still haven’t been able to help the fogginess.

I will say tho that I have brought myself a long way from when I first started this journey, made excellent improvements and crazy discoveries within my own mind and body. 

Recovering isn’t as hard as you might think so don’t panic okay? Doctors might say this is permanent but I promise you it’s not and has never been, this just like any sickness is a temporary condition and will eventually all go away.

Now this does not just go away in one day, it takes time just like anything in this world does so keep patience okay? The first order of business is don’t be scared of dp/dr okay? I know it’s easier said then done but trust me this is the first step to recovery, fear will put that sickness in more control, you have to let it know that you are not scared of it and keep moving forward.

Second step to recovery is to do things that challenge your fear, by being afraid you will instinctively isolate yourself, challenge your fears, go on walks, talk to friends even if it is scary, go do some activities like working out, cleaning the house, making your bed, reading books stuff like that. The more you get comfortable with this sickness the more it goes away.

The one issue I ran into was second guessing my own thoughts and emotions, trust me when I say that you do not have to do that because everything you’re feeling is true and it’s you. 

I found that watching movies helps a lot just be careful as to not getting to involved with the movie because this sickness will not like that. Be calm, breathe and slowly inch your way into the movie just as you would do for anything else. 

Don’t force this to get better, you will have your off days and you will have your good days and those good days will feel amazing trust me they will but don’t be scared when it comes back just except that it’s there understand that your still recovering and continue with your day.

By doing activities yes you will get to the point where you know deep down you did those things but at the same time you will feel as tho you never did it and that’s completely normal because what that is is it’s your mind thinking your in a life or death situation and it thinks you can’t handle this so it makes you go blank.

I fought this battle and I’ve made amazing progress and I know you can too! Reach out, talk to people who have also experienced this and recovered or are still recovering trust me your not alone, there are more people going through this then you might expect.

If you have any questions feel free to reach out and ask I’m always here, thank you for your time.

title: Why am i so scared and nervous?
content:
I'm a 17m who sadly inherented anxiety from my dad, and i've been asking these questionz to myself for a while.

My mom and stepdad are great parents, but, also argue a lot, sometimes, infront of me, and i have to hear it, now, my mom has noticed that their arguments do distress me, and she has said i should live my life and not bother with then, 'cus, in the end "all Couples argue".

Come today, where they have argued in the morning, and i immediately get a bit nervoys, the day passes by normaly with both working, but, once they get home, it's clear they are still angry at each other and, after dinner, here i was founding myself in my room, crying and asking myself "Why am i this worried? Why am i this scared? They are gonna be kissing tomorow morning maybe, why am i such a wuss?".

People said i worried because i was a "Good person" and wanted to see anyone happy, while, i do wanna see them happy, i also feel like i am just a coward that in any little incovinience, breaks down and gets super worried, and nervous, and overwhelming, and just... Wants things easy with no real dificulty.

My mom says that i am still to inocent due to the fact i wasn't really going outside or making good friends in school, so i never saw malice in anything, which i still don't get. 

What is wrong with me? Why am i this way? Why do i cry so easily? I don't have access to professionals right now and, i can't lie, i just want someone to explain me this so next time i atleast know why i am so weird like this

title: Anxiety causing physical symptoms
content:

title: Constant anxiety, I dont know who I've become.
content:
I 25(f) just constantly feel something is wrong or off with my life. Sorry for the long read, I don't post here very often but just don't know whom to share this with, its just been weighing down so long, like a shout struggling to get out. 
On surface everything looks fine, i have a job, i am enrolled in a masters program along with the job, i am in a serious relationship, i have somewhat loving and supportive family. I meet my bf we have fun, i meet my friends and everything is good. But that's just momentary. When I'm alone or sometimes even when im with someone, I don't feel real, my emotions don't feel real. I just feel like shell of a person, a fake. 
From past year, something suddenly shifted.
I'm in constant anxiety for no reason, I'm afraid of small daily tasks these days. I feel paralysed by my anxiety sometimes. There's always a pit in my stomach and my mind feels like a blackhole. 
I have become lazy, sad, a terrible procrastinator, i always feel tired,foggy in the brain and I just cant enjoy anything now. Ive gotten into some bad habits like smoking but I just can't stop no matter how many times I decide to, I think I like being miserable.
I sleep terribly everyday, get bad dreams and experienced sleep paralysis a couple of times, dreams within dreams and wake up unable to breathe. The later is very new and scary. 

I used to love so many things, everything I do feels insignificant and meaningless now. Like im not actually doing anything good or anything to be proud of. 
I don't like my face anymore, I hate my body amd how its changing. I have no confidence and I've lost the ability to actually think. 
I don't know how to talk to people any more, my mind often goes numb. 
 Even the love I feel for my family and my bf feels fake to me. My emotions don't feel real to me anymore. I've become snappy, irritated and angry. I never used feel like this, i used to be kind and loving and somewhat fun. I miss myself everyday. 
I'm very self-aware about my issues and what's wrong but I feel like i have no place to cry or complaint because nothing is actually wrong and I haven't been though any major trauma. 
But the constant anxiety, nervousness, guilt and overthinking everything for no reason is affecting my life and my personality, am I'm developing health issues. I'm always in fight or flight mode. The people around me have stated noticing something's off too. But i just don't know what to tell them. Every thought, every question, and situation just leads to my brain telling me 'I don't know, I can't think'.
I just don't know why did this happen or what to do or how to fix myself.

title: breathing anxiety
content:
Does anyone have any good tips that have helped them get over this?

I am constantly worrying about my breathing, it feeling shallow, if my hand turns a little red I freak out, worrying I’m just suddenly not going to be able to breathe and die, I just constantly focus on it (I fear I have developed OCD)

My doctor says my lungs sound perfect, my blood oxygen level is great(99%) , I’m on meds for my anxiety but I cannot get over this symptom. 

I use the calm app for breathing exercises and it helps, but only temporarily. The feeling always comes back. 

It has been almost 4 months of feeling like this, so I logically know if something was really wrong, I would’ve known it by this point, but it doesn’t stop me from really struggling with this particular symptom.

title: Propranolol truly is the best option to try.
content:
I’ve seen a few people talk about it, but i just want to reiterate how amazing propranolol can be for people with anxiety. As many people have described, and i myself had to deal with, any social interaction, or presentation, etc, i’d get so extremely anxious that i would start shaking, sweating, stuttering, etc. 

Ontop of my general anxiety, i had an anxiety induced nightmare about a (very specific) white 18 wheeler truck crashing into me and had to work the next day, at the time i was a server at a restaurant so that required me having STEADY non shaky hands. I couldn’t even get to work without having a giant panic attack. On the highway my hands just began to shake, and shake, and shake to the point where it was a full on tremor and unsafe for me to drive so i pulled over and freaked out a bit and was able to make it to work and luckily my manager was like “honey, just, take the day off” so i had my family pick me and my car up. 

at this point i was so over being chained down by this and needed to do something so i went to see my doctor. i explained, the fact i did NOT like traditional ssri’s or medications similar to those that effect the actual thought process of your brain. I’ve just always had horrible experiences and didn’t wanna test my luck. She prescribed me propranolol and on day 1, unlike ssri’s, it began working. I still had the worries of the truck but my hands wouldn’t shake, it weirdly enough would take all my physical anxiety symptoms, like shaking, sweating, stomach dropping, etc, and put it into my feet. Like my feet would kinda tingle a little. But then i was able to just keep pushing along. When i got to work i felt totally fine, able to serve people with 0% shaky hands. Eventually due to the “safety” that the medication made me feel, i was able to drive happily and freely again and began to lose the memory of that horrible nightmare. 

On a daily bases, it feels like a safety blanket i’m able to easily throw on. Even better is you can take it daily or as needed. Like i said, it only affects your body reactions from anxiety, so i do still have the occasional worry here and there about, well nothing but everything lol. But it’s just simply overall more manageable with this. Truly grateful this is an option now.

title: Opening up to a close friend about anxiety… didn’t go as planned
content:
recently decided to share my struggles with anxiety with a close friend, thinking they’d understand. Instead, their response was something like, *“Oh, everyone feels that way sometimes. Just try not to think about it too much!”* I know they weren’t trying to be dismissive, but it still stung. I opened up because I wanted to feel heard, but now I’m second-guessing if I should’ve said anything at all. It’s frustrating because they’re someone I really trust.

Has anyone else had this happen? How do you handle it when even the people closest to you don’t fully understand what you’re going through? I’d love to hear your thoughts. I don't wanna stop talking to them but ofc the mere thought of talking to them makes me real anxious 🥺

However this is becoming too much and I’m considering going back on meds. I did a genesight and spoke to a psych. We’re either going on viibryd or lamictal. My body cannot tolerate most things. title: Hight dose CBD and suicidal ideation- anxiety
content:
After struggling with life-threatening anxiety for ten years and trying various medications like SSRIs, SNRIs, and ketamine, I decided to give CBD a chance. I read some research studies and reviews on Reddit, which led me to understand that 600 mg of CBD isolate is considered the best dose for anxiety.

I purchased an oil that contains 200 mg per 1 ml. I started with a dosage of 100 mg and waited an hour to feel its effects, as I previously had experience with 20 mg gummies, which didn't have any effect on me. Ultimately, I ended up taking 600 mg a day. I followed this routine for two days.

I experienced intense suicidal thoughts and considered calling a support line. It felt overwhelming and scary, and I couldn't get rid of them. After about five hours, those feelings became milder and eventually faded away.

I couldn't find information about such side effects, but if you're experiencing similar symptoms, give your body a few hours to process them and remember that you're not alone.

title: MRI scan - anxiety and breathing problems
content:
I don’t know where to post this so going to try here. I have to have an MRI scan tomorrow and I am absolutely petrified. I had one years ago which was probably around 20ish minutes but I didn’t have breathing or heart rate problems then, I do now.

I have a condition where the inside of my nose was severely damaged by a surgeon by laser, and I cannot sense my breathing anymore, so I always feel like I am suffocating due to the lack of sensation and dryness, even though my nose is not blocked. Because the receptors in my nose are damaged, my nose cannot ‘communicate’ to my brain that I’m breathing, which results in a constant ‘fight or flight’ feeling. I also have anxiety generally and several chronic health conditions meaning i’m in pain all the time and POTS, but the anxiety over not being able to breathe my way through the scan is making me feel like I’ll throw up it is so intense. 

At home I have my nose covered over a lot to block some air (i have a loss of turbinate tissue so my nose is ‘too open’ and air rushes to my throat- hard to explain unless you have turbinate damage) and I have to keep the room humidified all the time or I get terrible pain in my nose, sinuses and throat. Cold air is also unbearable to me now and feels like brain freeze in my face. At the hospital I will of course have no control over any of these things. 

I am severely anxious about this scan. I will take a diazepam but I’m fairly sure last time I took one years ago it didn’t do a lot for me. I didn’t really have time to prepare as I was offered a cancellation so it’s all a bit last minute. I’m so scared of how I will remain still in such a small tube. I also thought I was having a scan that would be a max of 30 minutes and I’ve now been told it’ll be an hour, and this is what has made me completely lose it with anxiety. 

Does anyone have any tips to help me get through this? I’m honestly petrified :(

title: How can I better manage my anxiety in dating relationships
content:
30M. Long story short, I’ve been left feeling hurt by relationships in the past & growing up in a broken home. 

Dating a girl now, I love her. For the most part we communicate really well. But sometimes it breaks down and we have some sort of argument & then she gets quiet because she’s upset.

I understand she’s probably not in the talking mood when we just had that argument. But when I feel her pull back like that it really starts to eat me on the inside & I start to over analyze every small interaction we have, and then my mind immediately jumps to “she’s going to breakup with me” or “she cheated on me, she’s talking to someone else”. It becomes difficult for me to sleep & focus on my work. I work in tech so I feel pressure to perform there, and maintaining that high performance is hard when anxiety is eating me up.

I’d like to take better control over my anxiety and in those moments of silence learn to be okay, and somehow trust myself that no matter what happens, even if I found out she cheated or something, that I’ll be okay, and I’ll be strong, and move forward. After being cheated on & seeing it between my parents, that seems like the best way forward for my inner-peace, so I can also not put so much pressure from my anxiety on my partner.

Any thoughts on this? I’ve been in and out of therapy for several years, it’s gotten better but still I feel I have a lot of work to do.

title: THC has given me anxiety every night. Please help!
content:
I’m 20 years old and I started smoking weed  (mostly THC) in December 2021. Every day since then I’ve practically smoked at least my THC pen or pot, and it was never really a problem. I noticed after a while I started to get social anxiety after I smoked and preferred to be alone and work out or listen to music. I loved weed so much until after I went on a three month trip overseas. While I was overseas, there was absolutely no access to any marijuana or THC which I didn’t mind because I wanted to take a tolerance break anyways. I had so much fun on my trip and just returned a few days before Thanksgiving (2024). Please note that I became a pretty avid caffeine drinker while I was overseas and brought the habit back when I returned to America. Upon coming home, I decided to buy another THC pen and got high almost every day until the Wednesday before Christmas. That I had a lot of caffeine, and hit my pen multiple times throughout the day. That night before I went to bed, I had decided to take two good hits of my Looper disposable. (I had used so many Looper disposables in the past so I trusted the brand). Guys. When I tell you, this was the most terrifying night of my life. I kid you not. I was up for seven hours pacing around my room in the bathroom feeling like I was having a heart attack and it felt like my neck was getting stabbed every few minutes. My body was shaking, and I was profusely sweating. I legitimately thought I got a laced pen (even though I was hitting it the previous days and felt fine). I ended up staying up all night and the day after I ate a Hardy meal and drink some water and ultimately after that night I did feel better. It doesn’t end there though.
I decided to throw away that looper pen and get another, which seemed to not have as extreme effects, but I noticed that my throat would always feel constricted and I would get this weird sensation in my head every few minutes that was very uncomfortable. As a THC fein, I was determined to keep smoking at least a little bit every day because it would help me during my gym sessions and as a musician I felt like it made music sound 100% better. Fast-forward to this previous Thursday Night, January 16, I hit my pen around 9:30pm before going to bed and felt completely fine and ended up going to sleep. Maybe around three in the morning I woke up to a horrifying sensation in my brain and my body was shaking. It felt like my body was going through “waves” of the beginning of a heart attack. I was unable to go to sleep that night but in the morning, I honestly felt fine. Here’s the thing: I am STILL unable to get a full nights sleep without waking up to this feeling, and it only comes at night when I’m trying to get rest. So here’s my question. Are there anyone else who has ever felt this way and is this something that can be undone?? And what is causing this? Was it the copious amount of caffeine over the weeks mixed with my indulgence with THC? Honestly, at this point, I’ve pretty much accepted that I can’t smoke THC or weed again but it seems like this anxiety at night will NOT go away. it’s been four nights now I’m genuinely upset that after all these years of using THC to feel good it has turned on me and made my body feel like it’s essentially shutting down. I would really like to hear feedback on the situation and see if anyone else has similar experiences because this is a bizarre feeling. Almost feels like it’s never gonna end.

title: Is it even possible to reduce anxiety if you don’t tackle the root cause first?
content:
I have a question for folks who have been working through their anxiety challenges. 

Do you believe that there are certain challenges that require action before we can reduce anxiety? Or can we work on reducing anxiety while still facing those challenges?

Let me give a prime example. If someone is facing financial difficulties, isn’t it better to take actions to resolve those financial challenges—especially if those challenges are a direct cause of their anxiety? Eg. You can’t meditate your way out of certain problems. And no amount of coping mechanisms can truly fix those challenges if the challenges themselves are what’s fueling your anxious state.

So, yeah, I’d love to hear the perspectives of others on this.
